Name: Fireweed Sangha of Mindful Living
Description: We're a community of people in Anchorage, Alaska who practice Buddhism according to the teachings of Zen teacher Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Juneau Blooming Lotus Sangha
Description: Community of Mindful Living with resident Dharma Teacher and members of the Order of Interbeing offering mindfulness practice opportunities, Days of Mindfulness, Retreats, etc

Name: Big Spring Sangha
Description: Big Spring Sangha is a caring and inclusive community practicing in the Plum Village Tradition in Huntsville, Alabama. We meet weekly to practice sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing, and listen to Dharma talks. There is an opportunity to recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings once per month.

Name: Gulf Shores Mindfulness Sangha
Description: Dharma discussions, meditation and mindful walks.

Name: The Cahaba River Sangha
Description: The Cahaba River Sangha is a community of people practicing mindfulness meditation together in a caring and accepting environment. Meeting in person and on Zoom, we welcome individuals from all walks of life, faiths, sexual orientations, and backgrounds..

Name: Dogwood Blossom Sangha
Description: Dogwood Blossom Sangha is a community in Fayetteville, Arkansas practicing mindfulness in the spirit and tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. The focus of our practice is to cultivate the energy of mindfulness, understanding, and compassion in ourselves, in our families, in our community, and in the world. We come together weekly and for other occasions, such as days of mindfulness, community service, and retreats, to practice as a sangha. We practice sitting meditation, walking meditation, and dharma sharing circles. The group is lead by an aspirant of the Order of Interbeing of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: River Valley Sangha Mindfulness Practice Group
Description: Weekly practice consists of sitting meditation, walking meditation, reading and mindful discussion, recitations from Order of Mindfulness Practice, and enjoying the present moment.

Name: Desert Cactus Sangha
Description: Sangha flow - sitting meditation, walking meditation, sitting meditation, read mindfulness trainings, Dharma talk, open discussion. We usual have a weekend residential retreat once a year. Beginning and experienced meditators are welcome.

Name: Joyful Mountain Sangha
Description: Sitting and walking meditations, chanting, and mindfulness trainings recitations.We have a half day of mindfulness together every quarter.Our in-person sessions are hybrid with an online community.We have book study groups twice a week.30-day intensive mindfulness periods twice a year.

Name: Singing Bird Sangha
Description: Meditation, dharma talks, dharma sharing, mindfulness trainings

Name: Brilliant Moon Women’s Sangha
Description: Practices include sitting and walking meditation, Dharma talk and discussion.

Name: Colorado Community of Mindful Living
Description: The Colorado Community of Mindful Living (CCML) is made up of individual practitioners from regional community groups (sanghas) practicing in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Our purpose is to nurture the practice of mindfulness and to host days of mindfulness and retreats. Beginners and those with experience are welcome.

Name: Eyes of Compassion Sangha; Wake Up Denver Sangha
Description: We are a diverse group of practitoners sitting together with the intention of increasing peacefulness and insight in families, our society, and ourselves. We come from all backgrounds, cultures and ideologies and have been drawn together by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. Our format is 20 minutes of sitting meditation / 20 minutes of walking meditation / 20 minutes of sitting meditation, followed by tea meditation and dharma discussion.

Name: Flowering Mountain
Description: Small, committed group of practitioners in the Plum Village Tradition.  All welcome.

Name: Full Moon Sangha
Description: We welcome everyone from beginners to experienced practitioners. Please join us for seated meditation, walking meditation, tea and discussion. BelMar Area; please call for directions.

Name: Laughing Sangha
Description: Please join us for sitting, walking, and other meditation in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition. We love having Order of Interbeing friends stay with us. We lived at Deer Park for several winter retreats.

Name: Lotus Blossom Sangha
Description: The Lotus Blossom Sangha meets via zoom from 7-8:45 on Tuesday evenings and once a month in person in Longmont, CO. We typically sit for 20-30 minutes, sometimes practicing walking mediation, listening to chants or guided meditations and then share a dharma teaching and dharma sharing

Name: Mountain Peace Sangha
Description: We are a sangha serving southwest Colorado and northwest New Mexico which practices in the Plum Village tradition, offering sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing, recitations of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, and singing together! We also offer days of mindfulness and children's programs on a periodic basis.

Name: New Moon Sangha
Description: The Sangha practices in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition

Name: Peaceful Heart Sangha
Description: Our Sangha practices in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition

Name: Peaceful Presence Sangha
Description: Our sangha is small (we average about 8 members each sitting) and we practice in the Plum Village tradition. We share walking meditation, silent meditation, tea meditation, a reading and dharma sharing.

Name: Queer Eyes of Compassion
Description: We are a LGBTQIA+ affinity group associated with Eyes of Compassion Sangha.  We welcome all LGBTQIA+ participants

Name: Spacious Heart Sangha
Description: Practices includes sitting and walking meditation, tea and cookies, teachings and discussion. We meet in Suite 307.

Name: Still Mind Sangha
Description: We gather at 6:30 for soup and chat and begin sitting meditation at 7:00 pm. We practice guided, silent, walking and tea meditation followed by Dharma sharing.

Name: Sun Mountain Sangha
Description: Our format includes welcome and introductions followed by guided meditation, walking meditation, reading one of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, silent meditation and dharma discussion. For people who cannot attend in person, we provide a zoom link each week.

Name: Tuesday Night Sangha
Description: Our Tuesday night practice includes a monastic teaching, sitting and walking meditation, chanting, and an optional vegetarian dinner. The monastery also hosts Days of Mindfulness on the first and third Saturdays of each month.

Name: Accepting Heart Sangha
Description: Accepting Heart Sangha meets in my home in southeastern Connecticut. All are welcome. Members are, however, largely retired, the hour and the community being what they are.

Name: Community of Mindfulness
Description: Our Sangha includes sitting meditation, walking meditation, and Dharma sharing.

Name: Earth Holder Sangha
Description: We share the 5 MTS every other week. We walk, sit, sing, and have dharma sharing at each meeting. Sometimes we read from Thay's books, sometimes we read a sutra or a Bhodisattvah vow.

Name: Fairfield County/Westport/Harmony Sangha
Description: The Fairfield County extension of Harmony Sangha. We rotate our meeting locations in the Westport/Wilton area of Fairfield County, Connecticut. Information about our schedule can be found in the Harmony Sangha weekly email or on our Facebook page. Evenings are typical Plum Village practice - sitting, walking, sitting, dharma sharing. All are welcome.

Name: Greater Hartford Sangha
Description: Sitting Meditation, Dharma Sharing, Recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Currently online only.

Name: Harmony Sangha
Description: We are a welcoming sangha practicing in the Plum Village tradition. Our weekly practice includes sitting meditation, indoor walking meditation, and dharma sharing. There is an opportunity for outdoor walking meditation in the hour before our meeting. We enjoy regular sangha days of mindfulness. Third Thursday gathering are in Easton, CT. Visit our website for additional details.

Name: Inner Silence Sangha
Description: A sangha developing in Mystic CT to practice sitting/walking meditation and dharma sharing.

Name: New London Community of Mindfulness AM
Description: NLCM-AM is a small but warm and welcoming group, with an optional breakfast extension at the Washington Street Coffee House following our regular meeting. Our practice includes sitting meditation, walking meditation, Dharma sharing, and monthly recitation of the 5 mindfulness trainings, with readings from Thich Nhat Hanh. We're temporarily meeting virtually on Zoom.

Name: Po Jama Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition of Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. Our practice is lighting candle offering 2-3 touchings of the earth to the 3 jewels, meditation (sit walk sit, sometimes guided, approximately 60 minutes), serve tea, tea Gatha enjoy our tea!, Dharma discussion (with facilitator offers topic or reading ). Last Tuesday of the month: 5 Mindfulness Trainings recitations. We have long retreats during the course of the year.

Name: Willimantic Sangha
Description: Our Sangha includes sitting, walking, teachings, and Dharma sharing. We practice in the spirit of the Plum Village tradition.

Name: Opening Heart Mindfulness Community
Description: The Opening Heart Mindfulness Community is open to everyone and meets to practice sitting and walking meditation and discuss mindfulness-related topics. We practice together in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Washington Mindfulness Community
Description: The Washington Mindfulness Community, formed in 1989, is a Buddhist community of lay practitioners inspired by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet weekly (online during the pandemic) for sitting/walking meditation, listening to talks by Thay, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, guest talks by dharma teachers in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hahn, and other related mindfulness practices.

Name: St. Jones River Lotus Sangha
Description: We meet weekly to practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh at (Congregation Beth Shalom). We practice using guided and sitting meditation, enhanced by recorded chanting and Dharma talks. Walking meditation and discussion of practice are also included. Chairs are provided. This practice is supported by the Unitarian Universalists of Central Delaware.

Name: A Grain of Sand
Description: Guided meditation, silent meditation, readings of Thich Nhat Hanh's teachings, Dharma sharing, recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings, and Days of Mindfulness

Name: Blooming Lotus Sangha
Description: Mindfulness practice center with resident Dharma Teachers, mindfulness instructors, and O.I. members serving People of Color (POC), members of the majority culture, and White allies for over 2 decades. We provide Days of Mindfulness, family retreats, Mindfulness in Nature programs, etc. We offer services in English, French, Portuguese, Spanish, and Vietnamese. Please visit our website for more information.

Name: Blue Ocean Sangha
Description: We come together weekly to focus on cultivating the energy of mindfulness, understanding and compassion for ourselves and the world.

Name: Broward Lotus Sangha
Description: Community of Mindful Living with resident Dharma Teaches and members of the Order of Interbeing. Offering mindfulness practice opportunities including meditation meetings, days of mindfulness retreats, family programs, etc. Serving Broward County and other South Florida locations.

Name: Caloosahatchee Rising Tide Sangha
Description: Join The Caloosahatchee Rising Tide Sangha for meditation. The evening includes sitting and walking meditation and the discussion of significant Buddhist teachings. We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition. Our weekly discussions usually involve examples of how we're applying mindfulness practices we're studying. Even if you are not familiar with the reading, you are likely to find something of value in the discussion and be able to share from your own experiences if you choose. All are welcome.

Name: Gulf Coast Community of Mindfulness
Description: Every Wednesday we gather virtually as a community to practice meditation and mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition of the Venerable Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. The practice session consists of a short dharma talk, walking meditation/mindful movements/pranayama, sitting meditation, and dharma sharing.Every 3rd Wednesday of the month we recite either the 5 Mindfulness Trainings or the 14 Mindfulness Trainings. These trainings represent the Buddhist vision for global spirituality and ethic.To register, please visit our website.

Name: Live Oak Sangha
Description: We are guided by the teachings and practices of Thich Nhat Hanh. Our gatherings are 2 hours in duration and include sitting, walking, chanting, recitations, readings (usually one of Thay’s books), mindful sharing, and singing. We hope you enjoy your time with our humble and noble Sangha.

Name: Mindfulness Practice Center of Ft. Walton Beach
Description: All are welcome. We are a Practice Center, in the TNH tradition, open most business hours. Regular community gatherings Weds. at 9:30. Please check the WEB site for hours and location of the Center.

Name: Naples
Description: We hold ongoing meditation, classes, and community events. Monthly Daylong and Residential Retreats. We also have several satellite sitting groups in St. Petersburg and Naples Florida.

Name: River City Mindfulness Community
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation, dharma sharing, Readings from Thick Nhat Hanh books, Five Mindfulness Trainings in the Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. River City Mindfulness Community BIPOC contact: Yvette Hyater-Adams, yhyater@gmail.com

Name: Sangha of the Sacred Path
Description: Sitting meditation which includes lighting candle and incense and Plum Village recitation. Meditation is followed by sharing. We walk the labyrinth.

Name: Space Coast Mindfulness Practice Community
Description: Sutra chanting, sitting/walking meditation, Dharma sharing, recitation of Five Mindfulness Trainings, Days of Mindfulness

Name: St. Petersburg
Description: We hold ongoing meditation, classes, and community events. Monthly Daylong and Residential Retreats. We also have several satellite sitting groups in St. Petersburg and Naples Florida.

Name: Sugarloaf Sanctuary
Description: Monthly Community gatherings prior to COVID, now through technology including zoom and message groups. Includes Dharma talks, meditations, ceremonies, and mindful eating with 5 contemplations. As we regularly host monks from Blue Cliff and a Virginia monastery, our Sangha has the honor of receiving the dharma through them.

Name: Sun City Sangha
Description: We meet weekly on Sundays at 3:30 for sitting and walking meditation as well as Dharma discussion. We also provide other opportunities for practice from time to time.

Name: Sunshine Sangha
Description: Our purposes to provide a space for the establishment of mindfulness in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen monk, Thich Nhat Hanh. Anyone interested in mindfulness meditation, as taught by our teacher, Thay, is welcomed to join. We will read and sit in meditation following the practices of Plum Village.

Name: Tampa
Description: We hold ongoing meditation, classes, and community events. Monthly Daylong and Residential Retreats. We also have several satellite sitting groups in St. Petersburg and Naples Florida.

Name: Breathing Heart Sangha
Description: We are a small practice community in the Atlanta, Georgia, area that follows Thich Nhat Hanh's teachings

Name: Columbus / Phenix City Areas Zen Buddhism
Description: This group is for anyone in the Columbus, GA/Phenix City, AL and surrounding areas to practice mindfulness and discuss Buddhism in the Plum Village Tradition, founded by Thich Nhat Hahn. We will meet in person every other week for meditation and dharma teachings. All are welcome. We are an LGBTQIA+ positive group. We welcome individuals from all walks of life, faiths, and backgrounds. We practice Sitting meditations, Dharma sharing, and discussions. We observe the Five Mindfulness Trainings. We meet One Saturdaya Month at the Unitarian Universalist Fellowship and every other Tuesday in one of our members homes.

Name: Mindful Breath Sangha
Description: We are a diverse group spanning ages 18 - 82. Each week we enjoy music, sitting meditation, walking meditation (weather permitting), Dharma lesson, Dharma sharing, and a candle lighting at the end of each gathering which is when members light candles in honor of, in memory of, in celebration of, etc. We then gather for a time of fellowship over a cup of hot tea and refreshments.

Name: Peach Blossom Sangha
Description: This Atlanta area sangha meets at the Red Clay Buddhist Meditation Community Center. Drawing on the wisdom of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh and the larger Plum Village community, we gather weekly to practice cultivating peace, joy, solidity and freedom within and around us. The schedule includes sitting and walking meditation, dharma readings and sharing. Once a month we recite The Five Mindfulness Trainings. We meet in person and offer a Zoom option. All are welcome.

Name: Shoal Creek Sangha
Description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, emphasizing engaged Buddhism through practice and action in our local community. We offer meditation for Buddhists and non-Buddhists of all ages, including sitting and walking meditation. During our Buddhist ceremonies, we participate in dharma sharing, sutra chanting, monthly talks by Plum Village monastics, recitation and observation of the Mindfulness Trainings, and the support of a daily practice for each member.

Name: Honolulu Mindfulness Community
Description: Started in 1998, we are a group of lay practitioners in the Plum Village tradition of the Vietnamese Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet regularly each week, have mindfulness classes in the spring and fall, host monthly mindful eating meditation luncheons, and have an annual retreat with Deer Park monastics.

Name: Laughing Frog Sangha
Description: Our practice consists of 20 minutes of sitting quietly while focusing our attention on our breathing, then 20 minutes of silent walking, and another 20 minutes of sitting and breathing.It is so much easier to practice meditation with others than alone. We practice together in order to strengthen our ability to live in balance and harmony. Mindful breathing is the key.Please contact us for the location.

Name: Mindful Maui Sangha
Description: Mindful Maui Sangha practices teachings rooted in mindfulness, inspired by buddhist Zen master and teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. We are a new sangha here on Maui. Looking forward to practicing with you! 6PM CASUAL TEA DRINKING, 6:30-7PM SITTING AND WALKING MEDITATION, 7-8PM DHARMA SHARING CIRCLE.  AT PRIVATE RESIDENCE email for address

Name: Awakening Heart Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition of our teacher, Thich Nhat Hanh. We practice mindful sitting, walking and Dharma sharing, and study teachings from Dharma books each week. We are beginner-friendly and we warmly welcome and affirm people of all ages, religions, genders, ethnicities, sexual orientations, abilities and levels of meditation experience.

Name: Des Moines Meditation Group
Description: We simply give a place for the people of Des Moines to sit for an hour. We teach breath meditation to newcomers, much the same as Thich Nhat Hanh. We also read from his books occasionally during our presentations.

Name: Prairie Oaks Sangha
Description: Through our practice in the tradition of Plum Village and with the guidance of the mindfulness trainings, we are committed to healing and nurturing ourselves, our community, and the diverse natural ecology of Mother Earth, for they are not separate entities. All are welcome and celebrated!

Name: Prairie River Sangha
Description: Welcome to the Prairie River Sangha, established in 2005 for group practice of mindfulness meditation in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. The Prairie River Sangha is a community inspired to cultivate the art of living life more fully in the present moment.The group meditation meetings include silent meditation, walking meditation, and discussion time.

Name: Winding Path Sangha
Description: Welcome to the Winding Path Sangha (originally named the Iowa City Sangha). Founded on January 20, 2016, our community of lay practitioners follows the tradition of Vietnamese Buddhist teacher and peacemaker Thích Nhất Hạnh, who says there is no path to peace; peace is the path. Because we know that path can be winding and often challenging, and to support peace within ourselves and in the world, our Sangha gathers weekly to meditate, hear from teachings by Buddhist teacher Thích Nhất Hạnh and others, share about our practice, and discern together how to live fully in the present moment at home, at work, and in our community. Everyone is welcome, regardless of beliefs or previous experience with meditation, Buddhism, or mindfulness practices.

Name: Beginners Mind Sangha
Description: We are a diverse group of people who practice mindfulness meditation as taught by Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Fierce Compassion Sangha
Description: We meet every other week for two hours. We start with Dedication of Merit, mindful movement and then 30 minutes of meditation. After a short vegan snack/tea break, we begin Dharma sharing. We have a study group meeting on another day as well as periodic Days of Mindfulness.

Name: Forest River Sangha
Description: New traditional sangha located in Peoria and Central IL.  Walking meditation when weather permits.

Name: Lakeside Buddha Sangha
Description: we convene virtually every two weeks. We also host virtual Days of Mindfulness and retreats, and co-host both “in person” and virtual retreats with other Sanghas.

Name: Mindful Breath Community
Description: Sessions include sitting and walking meditation, studying the Dharma, and group discussion. Open to people of all spiritual and religious backgrounds. Beginners are welcome! Sessions primarily in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition & include teachings from other spiritual teachers.

Name: No Mud, No Lotus
Description: We meet every Saturday morning for a 15 minute sitting mediation, a 15 minute walking meditation, a 15 minute sitting mediation and end with 15 minutes of a reading/Dharma sharing. We also meet on Tuesdays between 6:15pm and 6:55pm CDT over Zoom for 7 minutes of gentle neck and shoulder stretches, 15 minutes of sitting meditation, and 10 minutes of walking meditation.

Name: Rainbow Circle Sangha
Description: Rainbow Circle is a lay community in the Plum Village tradition of Buddhism. Our goal is to build a supportive community that gives wings to our meditation practices. We invite you to join us, make new friends, and enjoy the shared practices of breath, love, and walking meditation.

Name: The Great Wave Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition. We have sitting and walking meditation, dharma reading and dharma sharing.

Name: Circle City Sangha
Description: Each week we practice sitting meditation, absorb a Dharma teaching (usually via reading), and Dharma sharing (supportive listening).We hope in the future to engage in other Plum Village practices such as Total Relaxation, Beginning Anew, and Five Mindfulness Training recitation.

Name: Flowering Smiles Sangha
Description: Flowering Smiles Sangha practices engaged Buddhism in the Plum Village tradition. We are open to all ages and all people. We meet Wednesday nights from 7 to 8:30. We are exploring the Sutra on the Full Awareness of Breathing while cultivating a loving kindness relationship within ourselves, nurturing our compassion from insights and growing awareness of the three doors of liberation. We'll watch a Plum Village video or read from one of Thay's books.  This is followed by a discussion to clarify the day's topic, relate it to the full discourse as a whole and how it supports our daily mindful practice.  We transition this knowledge with intent upon experiencing the topic through meditation.  Lastly, we have dharma sharing about our meditative experience and new awareness.

Name: Flowing River Community of Mindful Living
Description: We are a sangha that practices in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition and welcome members of the local community of all faiths. We meet to meditate & to share our joys and difficulties. Our intention is to cultivate peace and joy as individuals so that we can make a positive contribution to our community.

Name: Simple Minded Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition and meet regularly since 2012. We begin with the bell, have a 30-minute silent or guided meditation, and then either listen to a talk by Thay or other Dharma teacher or share a reading.

Name: Deep Listening Sangha of Lawrence
Description: Friday afternoons include guided meditation, mindful movements or walking meditation, silent sitting meditation, and words or songs to live by. Third Monday evening practice includes: silent sitting meditation, recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, and Buddhist study and Dharma discussion. All are welcome at all of our practices, which are inclusive and accessible. No prior meditation experience is necessary.

Name: Louisville Community of Mindful Living
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Heart of Acadiana Sangha
Description: Online meditation and Dharma sharing

Name: Mindfulness Community of Greater New Orleans
Description: The Mindfulness Community of Greater New Orleans is a sangha in the tradition of Thich Naht Hanh and Plum Village.

Name: Northshore Rising Sun Sangha
Description: Our Sangha meets several days a week at different locations including an AA meditation meeting. We offer regular sitting and walking meditation practice in the Plum Village Tradition. We have several days of mindfulness throughout the year. Sunday night practice includes dharma discussion.

Name: Berkshire Mountain Laurel Sangha
Description: The Berkshire Mountain Laurel Sangha is a Sangha that practices in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Boston Old Path Sangha
Description: Monday morning: Newton Highlands, Newton. Tuesday evening: Beacon Hill, Boston. Wednesday evening: Coolidge Corner, Brookline. Thursday morning: Chestnut Hill, Brookline. Thursday evening: Jamaica Plain, Boston. Friday afternoon: Mindful Parenting, Brookline. Saturday morning: Chua Vietnam, Roslindale. Sunday evening: Cambridge

Name: Cape Sangha
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Chestnut Hill Hamlet of Boston Old Path Sangha
Description: We have been meeting for over 20 years. We meet in a private home to sit, walk, read usually something by Thay, Dharma sharing, offer Metta and sing. We recite the 14 mindfulness Trainings on the first Thursday of each month. The sitting is followed by a simple breakfast about 8:15 if you have time.

Name: Dandelions of the Heart Sangha
Description: We meet weekly for 90min with the first half on sitting and walking meditation, and the second half with Dharma reading or talk and Dharma sharing.

Name: First Light Sangha
Description: All are welcome to practice mindfulness and meditation in the Plum Village tradition

Name: Green Sea Sangha
Description: A twice monthly, 90 minute meditation group in the PV tradition, with guided meditations and music curated from the PV app & podcasts, with dharma sharing. Meets at the Unitarian Memorial Church in Fairhaven, MA. We meet in the Harrop Center, a Tudor house located in back of the main church and parish house, in downtown Fairhaven, MA. There is ample free on-street parking.

Name: Hopping Tree Sangha
Description: In person practice includes sitting and walking meditations, recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, dharma sharing and readings.Zoom practice includes chanting, sitting meditation, recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, dharma sharing and readings.

Name: Joyful Heart Sangha of Massachusetts
Description: We practice weekly on Sunday evenings, sitting in silence, walking in silence, reciting the 5 Mindfulness Trainings, and offering periodic Days of Mindfulness and Dharma sharing. Effective 3/08/20, we meet via ZOOM and will send the meeting # and password to anyone requesting to attend.

Name: Lincoln Green Fields Sangha
Description: We practice together sitting, walking meditation, reading together a book by Thich Nhat Hanh, Dharma Sharing and metta practice. We have been practicing together since 2011. New members welcome.

Name: Lotus Pond Sangha
Description: We are a group of dedicated practitioners who invite anyone who wants to join our online practice in the tradition of Plum Village.

Name: Mindfulness Sangha
Description: Our MA USA Mindfulness Sangha is now online during quarantine. We begin with a reading from Thich Nhat Hanh. Do a 20 minute sitting meditation. Then 5 minutes of standing meditation. 10-15 minutes of walking meditation Another Thich Nhat Hanh reading . A brief discussion. We close with an intention for our practice for the week. Our Sangha is new. Eventually we will add Dharma talks, Days of Mindfulness, and social gatherings including potlucks and picnics.

Name: Mountain Bell Sangha
Description: An hour of formal meditation practice, sitting, walking, sitting, following by personal check-in, tea, and dharma sharing on a text of Thich Nhat Hanh. Seasonal sangha potlucks, semi-annual days of mindfulness, quarterly recitation of Five Mindfulness Trainings. Winter series of meditation  classes  from 6-7 pm ET prior to sangha gathering. Shared sangha leadership. Everyone welcomed!

Name: New England Plum
Description: A listing of all New England states regional Sanghas, Day of Mindfulness and other day events, and retreats. A submission tab is available to add events and new sanghas.

Name: North Shore House Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition, though members come from various traditions. We meet in early Sunday evenings. We sit 20’, walk 10’, sit 20’, drink tea mindfully, read a selection (usually from Thay, sometimes from other Buddhist writers, have dharma sharing. Once a month instead of a reading we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings, and seek to live by them.

Name: Old Path Sangha, Coolidge Corner
Description: Everyone is welcome to this new group as we explore ways to bring mindfulness into our lives, families, work, and society. Each evening we sit and walk and share a reading by Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Path of Peace Sangha
Description: We are dedicated to mindful living and engaged Buddhist practice. You do not have to be a Buddhist to practice with us. Many members continue to participate in other religious traditions while attending sangha. All are welcome.We practice mindfulness inspired by Vietnamese Buddhist monk Thich Nhat Hanh. The foundation for our being together is the Five Mindfulness Trainings, which are the Buddha’s teachings on the basis for a happy life.Our community practices mindful living in order to help reduce suffering while increasing joy, harmony and peace in ourselves, in our community and in the world. Mindfulness is the energy of being aware and awake to the present moment. It is the continuous practice of touching life deeply in every moment. To be mindful is to be truly alive, present and at one with those around you and with what you are doing. We bring our body and mind into harmony while we wash the dishes, drive the car or interacting with family, friends and colleaguesOur Practice includes:Mindful BreathingSitting MeditationWalking MeditationDharma SharingDharma talks

Name: Peaceful Garden Sangha
Description: Each evening, we sit, walk and share a reading by Thich Nhat Hanh. Everyone is welcome. We have quarterly Days of Mindfulness.

Name: Peaceful Songbird Sangha
Description: We meditate, check-in with one another, share a reading from a teacher of the dharma, and follow with Dharma discussion, metta practice and a final meditation. We practice in the Plum Village tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, with its emphasis on engaged Buddhism and the art of mindful living.All are welcome to join us. Email us: PeacefulSongbird+owner@BostonOldPath.groups.io

Name: Quarry Sangha
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation, meditative readings of Thay's books, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: River Valley Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition of our teacher, Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet on Zoom every week for sitting meditation, walking meditation, dharma reading and dharma sharing. We also have a lovely in-person Mindful Meal each month. All are welcome.

Name: Tree House Sangha
Description: Bi-monthly meetings in the Plum Village Tradition. We practice meditation, mindfulness practices, dharma sharing and regular recitation on the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Each season we enjoy eating meditation together.

Name: True Love Sangha
Description: True Love Sangha is an international live online sangha dedicated to deepening mindfulness and cultivating the four elements of true love: lovingkindness, compassion, joy and equanimity. We follow the Plum Village tradition of engaged Buddhism founded by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Washington Square/Parenting Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition with sitting, walking, dharma sharing and recitation of the mindfulness trainings. You don’t have to be a parent to join the sangha.

Name: Baltimore and Beyond Mindfulness Community
Description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition. Our gatherings include sitting, walking meditation, Dharma sharing and talks, 5 Mindfulness Trainings recitation.We are a sangha for people of color and for social activists. We meet in Unit 1C.

Name: Flowers of Peace Sangha
Description: Welcome! We practice in the Plum Village tradition. Our evening gatherings include sitting and walking meditation, dharma sharing and dharma talks, and recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. All are welcome.

Name: Free Where You Are Prison Mindfulness Community
Description: We are a Sangha of incarcerated women and men and outside volunteers who meet weekly in three Maryland prisons for sitting and walking meditation and Dharma sharing.

Name: Fresh Breeze Mindfulness Sangha
Description: We have been practicing as a Sangha in the Plum Village/Thich Nhat Hanh tradition since 1997.  Leave a message for specific directions & other relevant information.

Name: New Dawn Sangha
Description: Sitting and walking meditation with Dharma sharing, all in the Plum Village tradition.

Name: Ocean of Peace Mindfulness Sangha
Description: We are a small grassroots sangha that gathers weekly for guided and silent sitting, along with walking meditation. We recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings monthly and enjoy Dharma Talks, Readings from Thay’s books, and Dharma Sharing. All are welcome!We also have an permanent online community with Plumline

Name: Still Water by the Chesapeake
Description: The Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center meets for meditation, study of mindfulness practices, and Dharma sharing. We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Still Water Kent Island
Description: Members of the Still Water community join together at weekly sittings and gatherings; at retreats, classes, and workshops; and informally, as friends. We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center
Description: The Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center’s core purpose is to nourish the seeds of mindfulness, compassion, and community in individuals, families, and the larger society. Members of the Still Water community join together at weekly sittings and gatherings; at retreats, classes, and workshops; and informally, as friends.

Name: Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center (Columbia)
Description: The Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center’s core purpose is to nourish the seeds of mindfulness, compassion, and community in individuals, families, and the larger society. Members of the Still Water community join together at weekly sittings and gatherings; at retreats, classes, and workshops; and informally, as friends.

Name: Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center (Gaithersburg)
Description: Sitting/walking meditation, weekly reading or video talk by Thay, occasional visits and talks by monastics in the Plum Village tradition, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Training, days of practice, retreats

Name: Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center (Sandy Spring)
Description: The Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center’s core purpose is to nourish the seeds of mindfulness, compassion, and community in individuals, families, and the larger society. Members of the Still Water community join together at weekly sittings and gatherings; at retreats, classes, and workshops; and informally, as friends.

Name: Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center (Silver Spring)
Description: The Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center’s core purpose is to nourish the seeds of mindfulness, compassion, and community in individuals, families, and the larger society. Members of the Still Water community join together at weekly sittings and gatherings; at retreats, classes, and workshops; and informally, as friends.

Name: Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center (Takoma Park)
Description: The Still Water Mindfulness Practice Center’s core purpose is to nourish the seeds of mindfulness, compassion, and community in individuals, families, and the larger society. Members of the Still Water community join together at weekly sittings and gatherings; at retreats, classes, and workshops; and informally, as friends.

Name: True Names Sangha
Description: Mindfulness Practice in the Plum Village tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh

Name: As You Are, so it's As You Are Sangha
Description: We practice at my home in a lovely, natural wooded setting with meditation, walking meditation, dharma readings, book study and dharma sharing.  We also practice recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings around time of the Full Moon.  Meetings are outside as weather allows.

Name: Camden
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Dharma Gates Abounding Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Full Moon Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Grateful Heart Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Lichen Center
Description: A place to reweave and remember our relations and cultivate a practice of nonduality, mindfulness and deep listening.

Name: Open Heart Sangha North
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Open Heart Sangha South
Description: Open Heart Sangha is a sitting and walking meditation group that practices mindfulness in the tradition of Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. We practice meditation to cultivate peace and joy within and around us.We practice together weekly and offer more extended practice through Days of Mindfulness at least quarterly. We also seek to participate as a group in visits to Blue Cliff Monastery, to retreats, and to events designed to interconnect the larger community of Buddhist practitioners.We are an open and welcoming community for any and all who wish to practice with us, or who wish to explore the Dharma and the practice to determine whether or not they will undertake the practice as a commitment.

Name: Peaceful Harbor Sangha
Description: Peaceful Harbor Sangha practices in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We are an active community, practicing together since 2013. All are welcome.

Name: Peaceful Heart Sangha, Augusta
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation, read together, Dharma sharing. Newcomers warmly welcomed! Meditation guidance available upon request.

Name: Peaceful Heart Sangha, Hallowell
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Ripples of Peace Sangha
Description: We are practicing in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Still Water Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: True Heart Little Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: True Heart Sangha
Description: The True Heart Sangha meets Sundays 9-10:30am, Thursdays 9-10:30am, and Wednesday evenings 7-8:30pm. Our Sunday sangha is the main group meeting. Thursdays is at First Congregational Camden, Wednesdays is in Appleton. For details please contact secretary for the sangha, Rob Wall at robwall2015@gmail.com.

Name: Bay Area Community of Mindful Living
Description: Sitting / Walking Meditation / Dharma Sharing / Dharma Reading and Recordings

Name: Building Beloved Community Sangha
Description: We are a spiritual community of mindfulness practitioners in Detroit, Anishinaabe Aki, the land of the People of the Three Fires, aka Michigan. We meet weekly online for guided meditation and Dharma sharing, and monthly for in-person outdoor walking meditation on Belle Isle. We welcome people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, religions, races, ages, and abilities.

Name: Heart of the Keweenaw Sangha
Description: Our group practices sitting & walking meditation; we listen to the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh; we practice Dharma sharing, singing/chanting; we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings. We offer tea meditation once monthly. We are now starting an evening study group to look more deeply into the teachings.

Name: Heart of the Keweenaw Sangha
Description: Our small group practices sitting and walking meditation; we listen to the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh, read poetry and other readings; we practice Dharma sharing, reading the Five Mindfulness Trainings, singing/chanting. We offer a Day of Mindfulness several times per year in various locations in our region.

Name: Huron River Mindfulness Community
Description: Sitting and walking meditation, chanting and singing in the Plum Village tradition, watch videos of talks and read books by Thich Nhat Hanh, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings

Name: Lansing Area Mindfulness Community
Description: Weekly practice: Sitting, walking, dharma discussion

Name: Mindfulness Group of Southwest Michigan
Description: Our regular meetings are from 90 minutes to 2 hours. The agenda for the meeting is typically as follows: 1. Introductions. 2. 20 minute silent meditation. 3. 10 minute walking meditation. 4. Reading about the practice of mindfulness. 5. Dharma Sharing (an opportunity to discuss the practice of meditation and mindfulness

Name: Sandhill Crane Sangha
Description: Our practice includes both silent and guided meditation, deep relaxation practice, and walking meditation outdoors, weather permitting. We have a reading or dharma talk, followed by dharma discussion. Lastly, we share a potluck meal together. We hold a spacious silence in this half-day practice.

Name: Serene Jewel Sangha
Description: Even though Thich Nhat Hanh is our main teacher, we also study other teachers. Once a month, we share an oral reading of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, utilize the Three Refuges in our closing ceremony, and generally follow our breath mindfully.

Name: The Bluewater Community of Mindful Living
Description: Meet at Unity of Blue Water. Sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing, Mindfulness Train. ings recitations

Name: Blooming Heart Sangha
Description: Blooming Heart Sangha is a community joyfully studying and practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Please visit bloomingheart.org for additional meeting times and locations, etc. NOTE: If you wish to (snail) mail, our address is: P.O. Bo 7453 Minneapolis, MN 55407

Name: Compassionate Ocean Sangha
Description: It is a group practicing in the Buddhist mindfulness traditions of Soto Zen and Thich Nhat Hanh. Throughout the year we have weekly gatherings that include sitting and walking meditation, dharma talks and discussions, mindful movement, chanting and singing, and other spiritual practices. Dharma talks focus on aspects of Buddhist teaching and their application to everyday life.

Name: Still Water Sangha
Description: We are a community formed with enthusiasm and joy, in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Meetings include sitting and walking meditation, readings and talks by Thay and Plum Village monastics, Dharma sharing, and regular recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Heartland Community of Mindful Living
Description: Sitting and walking medication followed by evening program with dharma sharing.

Name: Mindful Heart Meditation Sangha
Description: We meet virtually except the first Wednesday of the month when we are hybrid. We sing practice songs, sit and have dharma sharing.

Name: Missouri - Midwest Moon Sangha and Mindfulness Practice
Description: Midwest Moon Sangha and Mindfulness Practice is a community in the Plum Village Tradition, observing sitting, silent, walking, working meditation, and other joyful and meaningful practices. Our root monastery is Magnolia Grove in Batesville MS. We are the practice center for PVT in the St. Louis MO area but our reach online has extended across the Midwest, even across the US. Midwest Moon Sangha is inclusive and welcoming to all traditions so long as they are healthy and wholesome, but our practice is certainly Plum Village. We offer online dharma talks as well. We have spun off two other communities in cose fellowship with our sangha: Rooted River Wake Up Sangha which meets 7pm on Wednesdays online; and a community in Carbondale IL as well as a budding group mid-Missouri Please join us!

Name: Be Here Now Sangha
Description: The Be Here Now sangha is an all ages sangha that meets every Monday night from 7:30-8:45 pm, at the Open Way MIndfulness Center in Missoula, Montana. We have folks primarily in their 20's and 30's in attendance and attract a lot of university students. We are on facebook at Be Here Now Community and info can also be found at www.openway.org. Nicole Dunn, contact: beherenowcommunity@yahoo.com

Name: Flowing Mountains Sangha
Description: A Community of Mindful Living in the Tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh

Name: Joining Rivers Sangha
Description: We welcome practitioners of all ages, experience levels, and spiritual backgrounds. We do sitting and walking meditation every week, followed by reading from Thich Nhat Hanh's books and Dharma Sharing. First Monday of the month is a recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Fifth Mondays offer a special practice such as Touching the Earth.

Name: Open Sky Sangha
Description: Open Sky Sangha practices in the tradition of Ven. Thich Nhat Hanh. Each week we offer a guided meditation, walking meditation, silent sitting meditation during our first hour. We then transition with mindful tea into our second hour which varies each week. We may offer a Dharma practice talk by one of our members, a video streaming Dharma talk by Thay or the monastics, a tea ceremony, a book reading, touching the earth or some other mindfulness practice. All are welcome!

Name: Open Way Sangha
Description: Our sangha is rooted in the Plum Village tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Asheville Open Heart Sangha
Description: In the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, we gather in noble silence. The bell is invited. We enjoy a dharma talk, enter into meditation, ending in a 20 mimute group discussion on the teaching.

Name: Charlotte Community of Mindfulness
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet in Room 27. Mailing address: PO Box 38325, Charlotte, NC 28278

Name: Community of Mindful Living
Description: Welcome to anyone who would like to join us whether or not you practice in Thich Nhat Hahn's tradition.

Name: Community of Mindful Living in the Pines
Description: Ongoing mindfulness practice in the Plum Village tradition of Buddhism at Congregational Church of Pinehurst. Practices include sitting and indoor walking meditation, singing, readings from Thich Nhat Hanh's books, and Dharma Sharing. Beginners are welcome. Not appropriate for small children.

Name: Deep River Sangha (Greensboro)
Description: We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, and welcome everyone from beginners to experienced practitioners. We engage in sitting and walking meditation and Dharma sharing, and cultivate the practice of mindfulness life. Please let us know by email when you plan to visit for the first time or if you have any questions about our practices.

Name: Deep River Sangha (Greensboro)
Description: We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, and welcome everyone from beginners to experienced practitioners. We engage in sitting and walking meditation and Dharma sharing, and cultivate the practice of mindfulness life. Please let us know by email when you plan to visit for the first time or if you have any questions about our practices.

Name: Durham Sangha
Description: On April 8th, we will be temporarily moving to a new location: Durham Friends Meeting House: 404 Alexander Ave, Durham, NC. The sangha will return to our previous location in July (the address on Chapel Hill Road). Our time together includes a seated meditation practice, walking meditation, a teaching (sometimes with a reading), and time for sharing about our experience with the practice of mindfulness in our life. Every practice is an invitation and you do not have to share if you are not called to. And, at the end there is an opportunity to sing together.

Name: Gia Đình Tỉnh Thức (Mindfulness Family sangha)
Description: We have two OI Vietnameses in the group. The group currently has 12 adults, most are 35 - 45 years old, and 12 of their own children from 8 to 15.

Name: Greatwoods Zen
Description: We have a weekly Day of Mindfulness where we have regular sitting meditation, singing practice songs, mindful movements, walking meditation through the woods, Mindfulness Trainings recitation, video talks by Thay, Dharma sharing and a mindful lunch.

Name: Laughing Buddha Sangha
Description: Honoring our Wake Up and BIPOC community roots, we practice sitting meditation, Dharma sharing, readings, music and original heart offerings. We begin every gathering with informal snacks and chat in a private home.

Name: Laughing Heart Sangha
Description: We are a diverse, inclusive group of practitioners,,some new, some old, who gather every Tuesday evening to create a mindful community. We draw deeply from the teachings of our beloved teacher, Thich Nhat Hahn, and practice meditation, dharma teachings, and a very interactive sangha community. Please join us! BIPOC voices welcome and needed

Name: Mountain Mindfulness Sangha
Description: Mountain Mindfulness Sangha welcomes everyone to practice TNH engaged Buddhism, especially beginners. We also invite young children to join us; Outdoor practice monthly in Weaverville.

Name: Planting Seeds Sangha
Description: The Sangha is inspired by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Winston Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village Tradition and facilitate sitting/walking meditation, Dharma sharing, recitation and observance of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, and regular talks by Thay and Plum Village monastics.

Name: Peace Garden Sangha
Description: We meet every Monday via zoom. We do a 20-minute meditation and then have a reading and discussion of one of Thay's writings. After reading and discussion, we engage in dharma sharing. We conclude with a 5-minute silent meditation.

Name: Honey Locust Sangha
Description: The Honey Locust Sangha, in Omaha, Nebraska, is a community which practices mindful living in the tradition of the Buddhist monk, teacher, and author Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Lincoln Sangha
Description: A growing community practicing in the Plum Village tradition, with opportunities to enhance our practice in creative ways. Each gathering includes sitting and walking meditations, readings from Thich Nhat Hahn, and time for sharing/discussion. We look forward to practicing with you!

Name: Blossoming Heart Sangha
Description: We sit every week, except for holidays and vacations. Please stay tuned to the weekly email for updates and changes. Feel free to reach out if you have questions or to request support for your practice or to sign up for our emailing list.

Name: Peaceful Path Sangha
Description: We start with some sitting - usually lightly guided - followed by walking - a reading and then dharma sharing.

Name: Southern New Hampshire Sangha
Description: Our weekly Sangha meeting consists of: a short chant or recitation (for the last couple years we've used the Plum Village Morning Chant), about a half hour of sitting meditation, a few minutes of walking meditation, a recorded Dharma talk (by various Buddhist teachers lately), and Dharma sharing. We meet in person and online.

Name: Buddhist Sangha At UUCSJS
Description: Sitting and walking meditation, readings, Dharma talks, and Dharma Sharing in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Though we meet at a Unitarian Church, everyone is welcome to attend! Link to directions: http://uucsjs.org/directions-and-map/

Name: Great Bay Community of Mindfulness
Description: Weekly gatherings in the South New Jersey shore are offered freely by a Plum Village Lay Dharma Teacher, consisting of sitting and walkin meditation, study, and Dharma sharing. Anyone interested is welcome. Please email dbohn@pipeline.com to confirm.

Name: Great Wave Sangha
Description: Zazen, Dharma Chat, Kinhin, Five Mindfulness Trainings, lunch

Name: Hopeful Earth Inclusive Sangha
Description: Sitting and walking meditation, Plum Village talks, reading from Thich Nhat Hanh, Dharma talks, mindful eating

Name: Lotus Sangha
Description: Read Thay's books and practice mindfulness breathing.

Name: Mindfulness by the Shore
Description: We are a small Sangha 8 - 10 friends, who have been meeting 4 - 5 years. We practice sitting meditation, Mindful walking, Dharma sharing and reading from Thich Nhat Hahn's books.

Name: Practice Community at Franklin Lakes
Description: The Practice Community at Franklin Lakes invites you to visit us for weekly sangha including sitting and walking meditation, dharma talks from Thich Nhat Hanh's book and videos, dharma sharing and monthly recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. We have been meeting in person and simultaneously online as well for those who want or need to attend from another location. Reach out for online link.

Name: Sun Of Awareness Sangha
Description: We practice mindfulness meditation in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Blooming Lotus Sangha
Description: Currently the community meets most Tuesdays from 4:30 P.M. to 5:30 P.M.  All are welcome. Please confirm meeting dates/time when planning a visit, (1) send an email to blooming-lotus-sangha@googlegroups.com OR (2) send a text to george at 575-313-7417.

Name: Desert Rain Sangha
Description: We are seeking ways to integrate mindfulness into each moment in our lives. We practice sitting and walking meditation in the tradition of our beloved teacher, Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh at Unitarian Universalist Church Santa Fe. We enjoy short dharma talks and dharma sharing on mindfulness-based teachings by Thich Nhat Hanh. No experience is necessary. All are welcome. We invite you to practice meditation with us. If anyone would like to call/text Sue with questions, I am happy to meet them for tea and share about our sangha. If they prefer to email Donna, she also can answer questions about our sangha. We welcome all people to join us as an inclusive sangha.

Name: Muddy Water Sangha
Description: Since 2003 our sangha has practiced in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. We have no designated teacher. Instead, sangha members take turns facilitating the sangha meetings, using practices we have learned at retreats with Thay and the monastics. We have found that the support of a sangha is essential for our practice, and we welcome anyone who is looking for a group in this tradition. We named our sangha in 2003 for where we were when we started, and we also know that lotuses are in muddy water, and muddy water is in lotuses.

Name: Open Heart Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition, including 5MTs, bells, flower offering, readings and recordings of Thay’s teachings, sitting and walking meditation, Dharma discussion, and offering merit.

Name: Quiet Mind Sangha
Description: We meet and practice in the tradition of Plum Village and Thich Nhat Hanh. Our meetings may include walking meditation, seated meditation, Dharma talks, Dharma sharing, and reciting the Five Mindfulness Trainings and the Fourteen Mindfulness trainings.

Name: Lotus Valley Sangha
Description: Sitting meditation, walking meditation, deep relaxation, Dharma Reading, Dharma sharing

Name: Purple Sage Sangha
Description: Purple Sage Sangha is an integrative Plum Village tradition practice group. Weekly and monthly Sangha meet in the greater Reno, North Lake Tahoe, Truckee, and Carson City wide areas.

Name: Apple Blossom Sangha
Description: We practice mindful walking, sitting, and Dharma sharing, recite the Five Mindfulness trainings and listen to teachings from our beloved Thay and other Plum Village Dharma teachers.

Name: Beacon of the Heart Sangha
Description: Beacon of the Heart is a meditation Sangha open to all. Inspired by early Buddhist teachings and meditation practices, as well as those of Thich Nhat Hanh, we offer secular mindfulness and meditation. We are a peer-led organization, and offerings are on a dana (donation) basis. These group sits are offered by community members with short introductions, a lightly guided meditation, and may include time for reflection and sharing. We affirmatively seek inclusion. For more information please see our forthcoming website.

Name: Blooming Lilac Sangha
Description: Blooming Lilac Sangha is one of hundreds of communities worldwide that practices mindfulness as taught by Vietnamese Zen Master, Thich Nhat Hanh. We welcome newcomers. If you are new to the practice, we have an orientation session on the 1st Sunday of the month. It is held at 3:00 pm if people RSVP. We offer meditation 4 times a week plus days of mindfulness. We practice sitting and walking meditation; talks by Thich Nhat Hanh, Dharma Sharing, recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings; and other practices like Flower Watering; Beginning Anew; Gatha practice, Mindful Eating, etc.

Name: Budding Flower Sangha
Description: Budding Flower Sangha has two weekly practice groups - one on Monday nights (Newburgh) and one on Friday mornings (New Paltz). We also have a monthly Day of Mindfulness in New Paltz on the third Sunday from 10 am - 2:30 pm. Weekly practice includes sitting and walking meditation, Dharma Sharing of a reading, mindful speech and deep listening besides monthly recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings. Day of Mindfulness encompasses extended practices like outdoor walking and singing meditation, Mindful Eating, Deep Relaxation and talks by Thay or Plum Village monastic/ lay teachers. All are welcome to join us. A suggested donation of $5 helps to support the Church rental space and the Sangha.

Name: Budding Flower Sangha
Description: Budding Flower Sangha has two weekly practice groups - one on Monday nights (Newburgh) and one on Friday mornings (New Paltz). We also have a monthly Day of Mindfulness in New Paltz on the third Sunday from 10 am - 2:30 pm. Weekly practice includes sitting and walking meditation, Dharma Sharing of a reading, mindful speech and deep listening besides monthly recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings. Day of Mindfulness encompasses extended practices like outdoor walking and singing meditation, Mindful Eating, Deep Relaxation and talks by Thay or Plum Village monastic/ lay teachers. All are welcome to join us. A suggested donation of $5 helps to support the Church rental space and the Sangha.

Name: Catskill Mountain Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Cedar Cabin Sangha
Description: We meet in person weekly to practice sitting and walking meditation. Every other week is hybrid, in person and zoom. We host occasional days of mindfulness and seasonal  woods walks  to get in touch with nature. We have been drawn together by the compassionate and peaceful teachings of zen master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Cedar Knolls Sangha
Description: We meet every Saturday morning between 10:30AM and Noon New York time on Zoom, with participants spanning the globe from Alaska to Canada to the U.S. and Europe. Our meetings include meditation, a reading, and sharing. On the first Saturday of the month we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Local members in the NY area occasionally share mindful meals and visit Blue Cliff Monastery.

Name: Central Catskills Mindfulness Community
Description: We practice sitting, walking, and Dharma sharing in the Plum Village tradition.

Name: Community of Mindfulness/New York Metro
Website: http://www.communityofmindfulnessnewyorkmetro.blogspot.com -- for all New York City area sanghas; www.rockblossom.org for Brooklyn only; www.buddingflower.org for mid-Hudson valley
Description: We are inspired by the teachings and practice of Vietnamese Zen Buddhist Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. You can send an email to cmnymetro-subscribe@yahoogroups.com to receive latest updates about Sanghas in New York City area.

Name: Gray Birch Sangha
Description: We were established in 2019. We were co-founded by an Order of Interbeing member and a local Yoga Instructor. We practice in the Plum Village Tradition offering online meditations and Dharma sharing. We plan trips to Blue Cliff Monastery for Days of Mindfulness throughout the year.

Name: Green Island Sangha
Description: The Green Island Sangha is inspired by the teachings and practice of Vietnamese Zen Buddhist Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We are a grassroots Sangha, beginners and more experienced practitioners learning from and supporting one other on the path of awakening. We meet every Sunday, online and in person once a month at Adelphi University.

Name: Kingfisher Sangha (East)
Description: The meeting includes walking meditation, sitting meditation, dharma reading, and sharing in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. All are welcome–meditation instruction is available.

Name: Kingfisher Sangha (North)
Description: Kingfisher Sangha is a community of people who practice Thay's teachings. We are a Buddhist Community dedicated to mindful living and the engaged Buddhist practice of compassionate action and study. All are welcome!

Name: Kingfisher Sangha (South)
Description: All are welcome here! We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Together we enjoy Dharma readings, mindful sitting, walking meditation and Dharma sharing.

Name: Kingfisher Sangha (Sun)
Description: All are welcome here! We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Together we enjoy Dharma readings, mindful sitting, walking meditation and Dharma sharing.

Name: Kingfisher Sangha (Village)
Description: All are welcome here! We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. We do sitting and walking meditation, Dharma readings and Dharma sharing. Recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Lemon Tree Sangha
Description: Welcome to the Lemon Tree Sangha!We meet monthly at the Lemon Tree Yoga and Healing Arts Studio in Glens Falls, New York.

Name: Living Christ Sangha
Description: Interfaith Zen Practice in TNH tradition.  Many people have their roots in Christianity, but all people are welcome

Name: Love Circle Sangha
Description: Love Circle Sangha is a composite of three practice groups from the Tiếp Hiện/Zen Vietnamese Buddhist tradition. The sangha is a commitment to offering safe space for people of color and allies who are actively engaged in embodying a holistic approach towards anti-oppression work. We seek to be a refuge where people can alleviate suffering by practicing and studying the dharma together, and honoring indigenous traditions within our earth-based practice of Buddhism.

Name: Middle Way Sangha
Description: Traditional sangha in the heart of the city.  All are welcome

Name: Queens Morning Star Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Quiet Harbor Sangha
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Riverside Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Rock Blossom Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition.

Name: Sangha on the Hudson
Description: Sitting and walking meditation, inspirational reading, Dharma sharing, monthly recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Spring Creek Sangha
Description: Typical Sangha gatherings include a dharma talk (read or viewed on video), sitting, walking and guided meditation, and dharma sharing. Music (practice songs and chants) and mindful movement may also be featured, as well as regularly scheduled Mindfulness Training recitations.

Name: St. Mark's Community of Mindfulness
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Stony Brook Sangha
Description: Stony Brook Sangha meets weekly for a silent sit, walking meditation and dharma sharing. We also have a book group which meets monthly and a  beach sit  in the summer mid-week. Please contact us for further details. All are welcome - experienced practitioners or new to the practice. Check us out on Facebook: Stony Brook Buddhist Sangha.

Name: Sunrise Sangha
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation, a Dharma reading from Thay, and Dharma sharing each session.

Name: Village Moon Sangha
Description: All are welcome here. We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Together we enjoy Dharma readings,mindful sitting, walking meditations and Dharma sharing.

Name: Being Peace Sangha
Description: Mindfulness Community in the Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh hosted by Grailville

Name: Blue Heron Sangha
Description: We are a small friendly mindfulness community that follows the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We practice guided, walking and sitting meditation. Then we either listen to part of a Thich Nhat Hanh or another teacher’s CD or DVD, have a reading, discussion, or do some mindful movement; we end with some tea and a little time to get to know each other.

Name: Flowing Water Sangha
Description: We sit for 35 minutes and read from a book followed by an brief discussion. Then we do intercessions and have a final minute of meditation ending with Thich Nhat Hanh's gatha,  The day is now ending...  Each person does his or her personal practice.

Name: Flowing Waters Sangha
Description: We are a friendly group of meditation, mindfulness practitioners dedicated to living an engaged Buddhist practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. When we gather, we share a guided meditation, 30 minutes of silent sitting or walking, followed by tea and time for dharma sharing and reflection. On the fourth Sunday we recite the 5 Mindfulness Trainings together.

Name: Sunflower Mindfulness Community
Description: Open to all, no experience necessary. At our regular weekly sessions we practice guided, silent, and walking meditation; reading a short teaching from Thich Nhat Hanh or another Dharma teacher; and we close with Dharma sharing. Afterward we enjoy an optional tea and socializing time.

Name: True Names Sangha
Description: We meet via Zoom weekly on Thursdays evenings at 7:00 to 8:30pm. We meet in person once a month (weather permitting) at various locations in Northeast Ohio such as a park, museum or restaurant) decided by the Bell Master of that meeting. We do sitting and walking meditation, listen to Dharma talks by many teachers, recite the 5MTs each month, read and discuss Thay's books, chant, sing, laugh and dance.

Name: 1UC in OKC Sangha
Description: Readings from Thich Nhat Hanh, dharma sharing, sitting and walking meditation.

Name: Norman Meditation Sangha
Description: We meet every Sunday for a silent sit, sharing, and tea. While we are not exclusively a Thich Nhat Hanh group, there are now about a dozen of us who have been on retreat with Thay or with Larry Ward and Peggy Rowe.

Name: Prairie Wind Sangha
Description: We are an inclusive and diverse community grounded in the  art of mindful living  as taught by Thich Nhat Hanh and other teachers. Our gatherings include sitting and walking meditation along with other practices to deepen our understanding, compassion, and happiness.

Name: Singing Stones Sangha
Description: Singing Stones Sangha is a community of persons of various spiritual traditions who gather to share mindful spiritual practice in the tradition and teachings of Zen Buddhist Master Thich Nhat Hanh

Name: Ahimsa Acres Sangha
Description: Sangha activities include: instruction in mindfulness/vipassana meditation and teachings; regular weekly meditation practice and discussion/sharing regarding our experience using the practice in our day-to-day lives; recorded dharma talks; 1 day retreats; service work in keeping with the spirit of Thich Nhat Hanh and engaged Buddhism. We are a part of Ahimsa Acres Educational Center (ahimsaacres.org). We welcome new members!

Name: Coming Home Sangha
Description: We begin with PV practice songs, introductions, a reflection, two periods of mostly guided meditation with an exercise period between - a form of walking meditation, and Dharma sharing.

Name: Compassionate Lotus Sangha
Description: Sitting and walking meditation under the canopy at Mary’s River Park (and indoor locations for weather); readings, dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Meal sharing and music on occasions, to be organized

Name: Compassionate Presence Sangha
Description: We practice sitting/walking meditation. Using the teachings of our dear Thay and other notable Buddhist teachers we contemplate life issues and use the guidance provided to reduce our suffering. At the beginning of each month, we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings and delve deeply into how they may help us embody the mindfulness of speech, action, and thoughts suggested by those teachings.

Name: Evening Light Sangha
Description: We sit, walk, sit, a reading/teaching from Thay and sharing. Everyone is welcome

Name: Five Stones Sangha
Description: The Sangha is continually evolving and learning, and doing so in the spirit of Thich Nhat Hanh's teachings. Through meditation, reflection, and discussion we support one another and nurture our potential to be truly awake each moment of our lives.

Name: Friday Freshness Sangha
Description: Our Friday morning group welcomes anyone no matter their experience to join us for sitting and walking meditation, sharing the dharma from various sources and sharing our own wisdom in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Friday Snack Meditation Practice Group
Description: Abbreviated Mindfulness Session with reading, sitting, and darhma. Taking time to stop at the end of the work week.

Name: Joyful Refuge Sangha
Description: We are an open and inclusive Sangha. All are welcome to come join our practice of sitting and walking meditation, an offering of some form of teaching, and Dharma discussion time. We are meeting as hybrid, online and in person.

Name: Merging Rivers Sangha
Description: Our practices follow the Plum Village tradition and we have 2 local Dharma teachers who visit to help us in our practice. We offer guided meditations, walking meditation, deep relaxation and dharma sharing as part of our practices. We also offer Days of Mindfulness once a quarter.

Name: Miracle of Mindfulness (MoM)
Description: Sitting/ Walking meditation, Dharma Sharing, Reading, Visits by Monastics and IBers, Monthly recitation of the five mindfulness trainings.

Name: Mountain Wind Sangha
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, with emphasis on sitting , walking, guided and silent meditation. We enjoy chanting and singing plum village songs and music. We enjoy different teachings by Thay and at times do a book study.

Name: Open Heart Sangha
Description: In the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, our weekly in-person practice includes sitting and walking meditation, dharma reading and sharing. We host periodic days of mindfulness.

Name: Peaceful Refuge Sangha
Description: Sitting/walking meditation, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, occasional talks by Plum Village Dharma teachers.

Name: Refuge of the Heart
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition. Because of the pandemic, we are currently meeting by Zoom conferencing. Anyone wishing to join us is welcome

Name: Reverence For Life Sangha
Description: The Reverence For Life Sangha will host a monthly 3-hour practice including 30 minutes of Sitting Meditation, Walking Meditation, and Eating Meditation, followed by 20 minutes of Dharma Sharing, Watching a Dharma Talk by a Plum Village Monastic or Reading a Passage from Thay, and Discussion. We will begin each session with 30 minutes for Tea and Mindful Conversation, to allow participants time to arrive before we begin meditation. From time to time we will recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Still Water Sangha
Description: Currently we do a sit walk sit meditation in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Led by three OI members, we encourage your participation.

Name: The Cedar Sangha
Description: Cedar Sangha practices in the Plum Village tradition. We meet weekly for our practice, which includes guided meditation, walking meditation, silent meditation, a Dharma reading, Dharma sharing through deep listening and loving speech, then closing by offering the merit of our practice. Once a month, we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings and the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings during our Dharma reading. We also have quarterly Days of Mindfulness near the Solstices and Equinoxes.

Name: Thursday Night Sangha
Description: Thursday Night Sangha meets via zoom weekly. Our sessions include both sitting and walking meditation as well as Dharma talks by Thich Nhat Hanh, Plum Village monastics, or our sangha facilitators. We end our sessions with Dharma sharing and a Plum Village song. We also recite the Five Mindfulness Training on the third Thursday of each month.

Name: True Names Sangha Portland
Description: We sit in meditation for 20 minutes; we walk in meditation for 10 minutes; we sit for another 20 minutes; we read selection from Thich Nhat Hanh; we have Dharma discussion (each person has the opportunity to speak about what they like, such as the reading, meditation, their lives, and others listen without responding. It is a safe place to talk.)

Name: Wake Up Together
Description: At Wake Up Together, our weekly sangha gatherings are a cornerstone of our community and a source of deep connection and inspiration. Here's what you can expect:1️⃣ Engaging Dharma Talks: Our sangha gatherings feature insightful and uplifting Dharma talks delivered by our Order of Interbeing (OI) members. These talks offer practical teachings and guidance based on the wisdom of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. Be prepared to gain new perspectives, insights, and tools to apply mindfulness in your daily life.2️⃣ Mindful Meditation: Each sangha gathering begins with a period of seated meditation. Together, we create a peaceful and supportive space where you can immerse yourself in the practice of mindfulness. Through guided meditation or silent sitting, you will have the opportunity to cultivate inner stillness, clarity, and presence.3️⃣ Dharma Sharing: Heart-centered sharing is an integral part of our sangha gatherings. This is a safe and compassionate space where you can openly share your experiences, challenges, and insights related to your mindfulness practice. Through deep listening and mindful speaking, we create a supportive community where everyone feels seen, heard, and understood.4️⃣ Connection and Community: Our sangha gatherings provide a wonderful opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals who share a common interest in mindfulness and conscious living. You'll have the chance to meet and build relationships with fellow practitioners, fostering a sense of belonging and support on your spiritual journey.5️⃣ Mindful Rituals: Throughout the sangha gatherings, we incorporate mindful rituals that enrich the experience and deepen our connection with the present moment. These rituals can include reciting the Five Mindfulness Trainings, engaging in mindful walking, or other practices that cultivate mindfulness and reverence.6️⃣ Inspired Action: Our sangha gatherings are not just about personal reflection and growth; they also inspire us to take mindful action in our lives and communities. We explore ways to integrate mindfulness and compassion into our daily actions, and discuss opportunities for collective engagement and service.In summary, our weekly sangha gatherings at Wake Up Together provide a nurturing space for deepening your mindfulness practice, engaging in meaningful conversations, and connecting with a supportive community. It's a place where you can find inspiration, guidance, and a sense of belonging as you continue your journey of awakening and transformation.

Name: Cap City Water in the Wave
Description: Guided, silent, walking meditation, veggie snack share, teaching from Thich Nhat Hanh and discussion.

Name: Dancing Flame Sangha
Description: All are welcome to join us as we practice using guided meditation, walking and silent sitting meditation. We are in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Dharma Moon Sangha
Description: We begin with a short reading by one of our six lay facilitators. The reading is followed by a 20-minute zazen, and then another 15 minutes of walking meditation, another short reading, and then more sitting meditation. We end with an open-ended period of Dharma sharing, a chance to be heard, a chance to listen deeply.

Name: Flowing River Sangha
Description: 20 minutes sitting, 10 minutes walking, and another twenty minutes sitting zazen. Every month we have a reading fromMaster Thay's books and then have a Dharma dialogue about it for an additional half-hour.

Name: Lancaster Water in the Wave
Description: Weekly guided, silent and walking meditation, veggie snack break, TNH teaching and discussion at Lancaster Friends Meeting House.

Name: Laughing Rivers Sangha
Description: We are a Mindfulness Practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Laughing Rivers Sangha was started in 1991, and has grown continuously since. All welcome, long-term practitioners and newcomers alike. Our local Dharma teacher, Anthony Silvestre has been with the sangha since the early days.

Name: Mossy Path Sangha
Description: Our online practice includes a guided meditation for up to 30 minutes, Touching the Earth, and then a rotation of dharma sharing, sutra reading, tea ceremony, and 5 Mindfulness Trainings reading and discussion.

Name: Pocono Creek Sangha
Description: We are a member-led group. We practice sitting/walking meditation, including Plum Village meditations, Dharma sharing, recordings and readings of Thich Nhat Hanh's writings, and the recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.
