We incorporate the sharing of personal stories and humor into our group.

Name: Present Heart Sangha
Description: Weekly get together via Zoom or in person at chapel of Moravian Village in Bethlehem,Pa. We do readings, guided meditation and silent meditation. We also do Saturday morning retreats at Moravian Village.

Name: River Walk Sangha
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: True River Sangha
Description: True River Sangha is a community of friends who come from diverse backgrounds, united by a shared commitment to practicing mindfulness in daily life. We gather to sit in meditation, explore the teachings, and support each other on the path of mindful living. Our offerings include weekly in-person and online gatherings, days of mindfulness, occasional retreats, and other events.

Name: Water in the Wave Sangha
Description: Water in the Wave Mindfulness Practice Community practices meditation and mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village.

Name: Willow Branch Sangha
Description: Willow Branch Sangha (WBS) is a group of friends from diverse spiritual backgrounds interested in the practice of mindfulness in daily living, inspired by the teachings of engaged Buddhism by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Our practice consists of a formal program including: chanting, a reading, time for both sitting and walking meditation, and discussion, followed by tea and conversation. All visitors are welcome.

Name: Clear Heart Sangha
Description: Sitting/walking/sitting meditation. Weekly talks by Thich Nhat Hanh or PV monastic, dharma sharing and monthly observation of 5 MT.

Name: Generations Sangha
Description: A Family-Friendly Sangha which includes songs and children's books and activities based on the Plum Village Tradition, and an opportunity for adults to practice silent meditation and dharma sharing while children make crafts.

Name: Joyfully Together Sangha
Description: Sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, monthly talks by Dharma teachers in the Order of Interbeing

Name: Peaceful Waters Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We engage in sitting and walking meditation and Dharma sharing. We read the Five Mindfulness Trainings on a monthly basis.

Name: Radiant Bell Sangha
Description: We are part of the RI Community of Mindfulness practicing in the Plum Village Tradition.

Name: Indigo Sangha
Description: We are a welcoming and inclusive mindfulness practice community in the Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting and walking meditation, listening to talks, and sharing what is in our hearts. We want everyone who wishes to attend to join us. We especially encourage People of Color, LGBTQIA, and young practitioners (ages 18-35) and other diversities to attend. We provide simple instruction.

Name: Three Streams Sangha
Description: We are a diverse group that meets in person and on-line. Practices include chanting/recitation, meditation, Dharma reading, and Dharma sharing. We practice primarily in the Plum Village Tradition but also incorporate teachings from other spiritual traditions. As a community, we practice the first two of the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings: Openness and Non-Attachment to Views.

Name: Compassionate Heart Sangha of Vermillion
Description: Compassionate Heart Sangha is an emerging sangha, however many have practiced in the Plum Village Tradition for 20 years.

Name: Magnolia Sangha
Description: We have a Mindfulness practice, in the Thich Nhat Hanh Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting/walking meditation, Dharma discussion, Dharma sharing, monthly recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Mountain Solid, Water Reflecting Sangha
Description: We have been studying the teachings and practicing in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh (“Thay”) since 1998. The group warmly welcomes individuals of all religions, Buddhist traditions, and cultures. We especially encourage those who are new to meditation to attend. While we do not offer formal lessons in meditation, there is an opportunity to ask questions, share experiences, and discover resources during the sharing circle.

Name: Music of the Heart Sangha
Description: Everyone is welcome! No experience is needed. We have cushions and chairs. Our practice includes sitting and walking meditation, teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh and Dharma sharing.

Name: Peaceful River Sangha
Description: We practice sitting meditation, view/read and study Thay/Plum Village Teachers and practice dharma sharing through deep listening. Since COVID-19, we have continued to meet via online Zoom with most of our members in the Chattanooga, TN area.

Name: 3 Jewels Sangha
Description: I am starting a new sangha as a way to reach people in need of a beloved community. We are only meeting online currently but I hope to have a physical space where we can practice in person. I am hoping to build a community steeped in the Plum Village tradition and growing an OI team to support many local in person people, but also offering our current virtual meetings either as a hybrid meeting or separate way to reach remote connections seeking a solid community focused on mindful living and engaged buddhism. We currently are doing book studies (currently We Were Made For These Times book) and basic sitting meditation. My goal is to build a regular weekly practice of Sitting, Walking, Silent meditation, followed by a Dharma Talk (using books, articles, or videos by Thay and others) to offer a deeper lesson then community discussion time to share. I'd like to offer tea in our discussion time. As we grow I would like to start having Quarterly Days of Mindfulness. I would eventually like to build an annual retreat for the DFW community as we do not have anything like this locally yet. I will be leaning on OI and Dharma Teachers when we get to that stage but right now it is only myself facilitating.

Name: Awakening Heart Community of Mindful Living
Description: Spirituality, meditation and the joy of mindful living are the basis of all our Sangha gatherings. We are intentionally very beginner-friendly and we warmly welcome and affirm people of all ages, religions, genders, ethnicities, sexual orientations, abilities and levels of meditation experience.

Name: Cultivating Mindfulness Sangha
Description: Welcome to Cultivating Mindfulness! We are a group that is meeting both live near the TCU campus in Fort Worth, TX and on Zoom. We practice guided, sitting and walking meditation on Saturdays at 10 am in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. We also have a Monday morning book dharma meeting from 10-11 am CST on Zoom. We welcome beginners and all other levels of meditation experience. Please contact Diane for more details.

Name: Eastern Trails Sangha
Description: Welcome to Eastern Trails Sangha. We enjoy learning new ways to cultivate and grow together. Our community is very fun and creative.

Name: Interbeing Sangha
Description: All are welcome to join us for guided meditation, walking meditation, silent meditation and Dharma sharing every week.

Name: Mindfulness Practice Community of Houston
Description: MPCH is a community of lay practitioners inspired by the teachings of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We come together with the purpose to to support each other in learning to live with awareness. Our weekly practices include sitting/walking meditation, chanting, Dharma talks, Dharma sharing, monthly recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Peace Valle Sangha
Description: Weekly sitting meditation, walking meditation, Dharma sharing; recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings monthly; Days of Mindfulness quarterly; 5 Mindfulness Trainings Ceremony annually.

Name: Plum Blossom Sangha
Description: Plum Blossom Sangha is a community that practices mindfulness in the spirit and tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. The focus of the community is to cultivate the energy of mindfulness, understanding, and compassion in ourselves, our families, our community, and our world.

Name: Plum Branch Sangha
Description: We practice sitting, walking, Dharma sharing, days of mindfulness, tea meditation and recitation of the Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Sangha de la Frontera
Description: The Sangha de la Frontera is composed of men and women inspired by the teachings of Buddhism and of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Awakening Valley Sangha
Description: A mindfulness community practicing in the Plum Village tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Peaceful Steps Sangha
Description: Peaceful Steps Sangha is local community practicing mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition. Meetings are held in an outdoor setting. We start with 20 minutes of walking meditation, followed by introductions and an internal and external weather check-in by each member. Each meeting will focus on one of the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings. Each training will be recited and Dharma sharing on that training will follow. The meeting will conclude with the recitation of the Merits of the Practice.

Name: Praxis Sangha
Description: In person and online. (In development. Online in June, in person starting in July) We also offer periodic walking meditations in Utah’s outdoor spaces which we film and post you our youtube channel as “virtual walking meditations.” In the future we intend to offer day of mindfulness retreats, and hopefully bring Dharma teachers and Monastics for special events. We have a social media presence and are incorporated as a nonprofit.

Name: True Mountain Sangha
Description: We are an informal practice group. We meet Sundays at 5pm and start our sit at 5:15 followed by walking meditation or mindful movement and then a Dharma discussion. The Sangha occasionally organizes days of mindfulness and retreats. You can email us to join a mailing list to receive Zoom links and updates and/or be added to our public Google Group for updates.

Name: Cloud Floating Free Sangha
Description: We meet 2ce weekly to practice sitting, walking and dharma sharing. We recite the 5 mindfulness Trainings 2ce monthly and the 14 Mindfulness Training 1ce monthly. We support tea ceremonies, book groups and documentary series.

Name: Freedom Garden Sangha
Description: Freedom Garden Sangha is an in-person sangha, meeting in Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting and walking meditation for the 1st half of our time together and then we vary our program: reading from one of Thich Nhat Hanh's books, listening to a Dharma talk, reading the Mindfulness Training or other programs. We usually end at 8:00pm. We welcome people who are new to meditation as well as those who have experience. We are committed racial equity.

Name: Heart of the Blue Ridge
Description: Our practice is to sit, walk, read from books by Thay and other teachers that support our sangha. After the reading we have a period of Dharma Sharing. We include the Five Mindfulness Trainings regularly in our Sunday meditation practice.

Name: Mindfulness Community of Hampton Roads
Description: The Mindfulness Community of Hampton Roads was founded in May 1992. Its mission is to provide a sangha, or community, to support those who practice Buddhism in Norfolk and elsewhere in Hampton Roads. Although formation of the Mindfulness Community of Hampton Roads was inspired by the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh, it became evident soon after its inception that there was a need to expand its scope to embrace the support of practitioners from all Buddhist traditions, as well as those who practice secular mindfulness and have an interest in Buddhism.

Name: Mindfulness Practice Center of Fairfax
Description: MPCF offers sessions of training in and practice of mindfulness in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Sessions are offered in the secluded setting of the Unitarian Universalist Congregation in Oakton. It is a quiet, beautiful and spiritual space.

Name: Salt Marsh Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition since 2010. First-timers, please come a little earlier.

Name: Circle of Presence Sangha
Description: We are a welcoming group focused on the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh that welcomes people of all traditions to come join in mindfulness meditation with us.

Name: Heart of the Valley MIndfulness Practice Center
Description: We are a warm and welcoming community, and practice sitting and walking meditation, sharing, and other Plum Village practices. Several times a month, we read from one of Thay’s books. The Heart of the Valley Mindfulness Training Center meets in person every Tuesday morning, 9:00 to 11:00 am, at St Barnabas Episcopal Church, in Norwich, VT. Our sangha also has a zoom gathering every Wednesday evening, from 6:00 to 7:30 pm. We send out a mailing every weekend with information about the upcoming week, and a zoom link which doesn’t change.

Name: Mountains and Rivers Mindfulness Community
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation; recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings, read a book of Thich Nhat Hanh's, or watch a Plum Village video; and have Dharma sharing.

Name: New Leaf Sangha
Description: Our practice is in-person only (currently no Zoom options) and includes sitting meditation (two twenty-minute sits), ten minutes of walking meditation, reading together from one of Thay's books, and Dharma sharing.

Name: Anacortes Mindfulness Community
Description: Please join us for weekly sitting and walking meditation, teachings, study, and Dharma sharing. We host periodic Days of Mindfulness and retreats. All are welcome. See our website for orientation and contact information

Name: Buddha's Bookbag Sangha
Description: Since 2009, we offer a study group, using Thay's books, along with meditation, to nourish our practice and guide our dharma. Everyone is welcome and we will share the book at the meetings. Reach out to us as we sometimes change locations.

Name: Marrowstone Sangha
Description: We meet weekly for an hour and half to practice sitting/walking meditation, read from Thich Nhat Hahn's writings, Dharma Sharing, and songs. Occasionally we practice Touching of the Earth, Deep Relaxation or Tea meditations.

Name: Mindfulness Community of Puget Sound
Description: Seattle based peer led practice group in the Plum Village Tradition with 70 members in the Seattle area. A special People of Color Gathering is held twice a month on Tuesday evenings. We have a Family Sangha that meets on the 3rd or 4th Sunday of each month from 9:30 to 11:30 am.

Name: Mudbay Lotus Sangha Olympia
Description: Open to all in the Plum Village Tradition

Name: Thảnh Thơi Sangha (Tăng Thân Thảnh Thơi)
Description: Sitting/walking meditation, monthly talks by Thay and Plum Village monastics, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five & Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings, deep relaxation, mindful eating

Name: The Bad Buddhist Sangha
Description: Started on April 28, 2022, our sangha was created and co-facilitated by the late Dr. Bob Spivey, an ordained lay monk in the Vietnamese Zen lineage of Thích Thiên-Ân, and his life partner, Beverly Naidus. Both Dr. Bob and Beverly took the 5 precepts with Thich Nhat Hanh in 1992. The sangha does a check-in, then a guided sitting for 20 minutes, walking or movement meditation for 10 minutes, then a shared reading from one of Thay's books with a formal discussion, and a final silent sit.

Name: Tiger Mountain Sangha
Description: We enjoy gathering together to practice and support each other on the path of awakening. We practice with the intention to relieve suffering of all beings. Together, we practice sitting and walking meditation, reading Thay's books and practice dharma sharing with mindfulness and compassion.

Name: Vietnamese Buddhist Meditation Center Chùa Phước Huệ
Description: Please join us at our beloved temple for refreshing evenings of seated breathing meditation, walking meditation, shared reading, and Dharma sharing.  Mostly English speaking Vietnamese practitioners, but all welcome.  Often joined by Abbot Thầy Phước Toàn.

Name: Woodside Sangha
Description: Welcome! We are a group practicing in the tradition of Plum Village within the context of the larger Buddhist circle of practice.

Name: Four Lakes Sangha
Description: Four Lakes Sangha is a branch of SnowFlower Sangha. Our aspiration is to create a welcoming, safe space for all to gather and practice mindfulness. We are family and kid friendly, with weekly children's activities (both together with and separate from adults). In the warmer months we meet outside. The general Sangha format starts with both children and adults signing practice songs, followed by group walking meditation, then a short guided meditation from the Plum Village app. Then the children separate for their own program while the adults practice silent sitting meditation, followed by a Dharma offering and ending with a focus on Dharma Sharing. Dharma Offerings are: 1st Sunday - 5 MT recitation, 2nd Sunday - Chanting or Touching the Earth, 3rd Sunday - Children's Program for all, 4th Sunday - Discourse Reading, 5th Sunday - Deep Relaxation.

Name: Many Ways of Peace Sangha
Description: Many Ways of Peace Sangha meets weekly on Tuesday 2:00 - 4:00 pm at the home of Sangha leader Mary Jo Berner, 142 S. Aquila Ct, Eagle River, WI 54521 USA. Our sangha has been meeting since November, 2014, and incorporates music/singing, sitting meditation, discussion of Thay's teachings from his many books, personal sharing on the practice. New members are always welcome.

Name: Mindfulness Community of Milwaukee
Description: We have 11 Sangha meetings every week, sitting and walking meditation, Dharma discussion and sharing,recitation and observation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings every month, reading books by TNH and sharing in discussion of his writings. We have 60 members (formal membership) and many more visitors, including via zoom from far away places, an annual 5-day retreat and several weekend retreats, days of mindfulness, connection with other nearby Sanghas, Arise! meets weekly, Wake-up! meets every Sunday afternoon, we have an excellent website with our calendar and recorded Dharma talks and other material by our spiritual director and co-founder Dr. Paul Norton and senior Sangha members.

Name: Open Heart Mindfulness Community
Description: We recite the 5 and 14 MTs regularly and practice in the Plum Village tradition. Our Sangha includes Thich Nhat Hanh's talks and books, sitting and walking meditation, and Dharma sharing. We study and practice in an environment that fosters compassion, loving kindness, understanding, and inclusiveness.

Name: Red Cedar Buddha Sangha
Description: Sitting, Walking Meditation, Mindful Tea, Dharma Sharing, recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings, Dharma Talks by Thay and Plum Village Monastics, Sutra Study, Singing, Days of Mindfulness

Name: SnowFlower Sangha
Description: Our Tuesday and Friday meetings are at Friends Meeting House, 1704 Roberts Ct., Madison. Our Sunday and Wednesday meetings are in people's homes; locations are publicized via our email list, or you can call me.

Name: The Dancing River Mindfulness Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition.

Name: Windsong East Sangha
Description: We read, discuss a Thich Nhat Hanh writing, do Dharma discussion and meditate for 15 - 30 minutes.

Name: The Mindfulness Tree
Description: The Mindfulness Tree Charleston WV Meditation Community meets weekly in-person and online to practice sitting meditation and walking meditation in the tradition of Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Mindful Monday Meditation
Description: Room 5 - Upstairs. Practices include sitting and walking meditation, mindful eating, teachings or readings and Dharma sharing

Name: Snowflake Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition. Our weekly practice consists of sitting meditation, walking, a reading or Dharma talk followed by Dharma sharing and monthly recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Organic Garden Sangha
Description: We are a community practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We begin each practice session with silent sitting meditation, followed by walking meditation and a sangha topic of the week. We may listen to dharma talks, practice Touching the Earth, engage in Dharma Sharing, sing, chant, and engage in other activities to strengthen our mindfulness practice. On the first Saturday of each month, we rotate study and recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings and the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings of the Order of Interbeing. ​We are a peaceful and harmonious sangha that supports mindfulness in daily living--in our homes, in our families, in our workplaces, and in our communities.Organic Garden Sangha began practicing in 2003 and continues to meet every Saturday morning starting at 8:00 am.

Name: Live Oak Sangha
Description: Live Oak Sangha is a mindfulness meditation group in the Plum Village Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet in a high quality hybrid format, with some people attending in person and some people attending by Zoom. Beginners, long time practitioners, and people who have never meditated but think they might like to explore a Buddhist practice are invited to join us. Our Sangha began practicing in 2004. We base our practices upon the Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. We start with a check-in, 20-minute silent sitting meditation and 10 minutes of walking meditation, followed by 30 minutes of dharma study. We may have another short silent sitting meditation and then our closing. During our Dharma time we study together from a common book, with occasional articles of interest or discussions of our individual practices. These include Thich Nhat Hanh and many other teachers’ works. We also sometimes participate in retreats or special events in the area. Everyone is welcome!

Name: Mindful Peacebuilding Sangha
Description: Mindful Peacebuilding is an inclusive welcoming community offering a mindfulness-based approach to cultivating peace and justice. We draw inspiration from the wisdom and compassion teachings of contemporary peacemakers such as Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh as well as from young people, ancestral traditions, and the world of nature. We are open to all who wish to engage societal challenges in a mindful context.

Name: Couples Sangha
Description: We meet weekly, usually via Zoom, in person once per month.

Name: Hella Just & Compassionate Sangha
Description: East Bay meditation family committed to holding a People of Color space to grow in our practice so that we can be better people, working in better ways, for a better world. At least once per month on Sundays.

Name: Spiritual Friends Sangha
Description: Currently on hiatus

Name: Zen Mindfulness Fellowship
Description: We meet in the Pedro Arrupe Room, in the basement of St Ignatius Church, 650 Parker, near Fulton. Please contact Gary Gach, a day in advance, for directions.

Name: Deepening White Awareness Sangha for Racial Healing and Equity
Description: As self-identified white practitioners, we enjoy mindful sitting, walking, and Dharma sharing in Thay’s tradition, seeking to transform and heal the seeds of racism in ourselves and the world.

Name: Elephant Mountain Sangha
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition. Breakfast, Dharma sharing and Dharma discussion to follow at the Station House Cafe.

Name: Family Sangha
Description: We practice 30 minutes of meditation, reading, and Dharma Sharing hosted by Sally and Beem Wilder. We are meeting via Zoom, and in person in Los Gatos or Los Feliz. Contact Sally or Beem for details.

Name: Flowering Tree Sangha
Description: On Zoom with occasional in-person gatherings at Mindfulness & Health Office, 300 Plaza South, Los Altos.

Name: Flowing Waters Sangha
Description: Traditional sangha in the Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. We welcome beginners as well as experienced practitioners. Activities include silent and guided meditations, walking meditation, reading from Thich Nhat Hanh, and Dharma sharing.

Name: Heart Sangha
Description: The Heart Sangha practices in the Plum Village tradition. Each sangha gathering consists of sitting and walking meditation, Dharma talks by sangha facilitators who are long-term practitioners in this tradition, and time for Dharma sharing. We recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings on the first Monday of each month.

Name: Joyful Heart Sangha
Description: The Joyful Heart sangha welcomes meditators and practices in the Plum Village tradition. We gather at 7:00, begin with a sitting meditation, followed by a walking meditation and then either a guided meditation, a recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, or a recording by Thay or a passage of one of his books, followed by dharma sharing. We also sing practice songs on occasion.

Name: Karuna Garden Sangha
Description: Karuna Garden Sangha is an inclusive, peer-led online community where practitioners of all levels come together to practice meditation, share Dharma, and support each other's growth. We offer a welcoming space for individuals to explore and contribute to our collective mindfulness practice in a safe and supportive environment.

Name: La Boi Sangha
Description: Meets once a month with Potluck lunch. Please contact us for date and locaton. Vietnamese-speaking, bilingual English option.

Name: Lotus in a Sea of Fire Sangha
Description: Online sangha for Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) practitioners who are members or aspirants of the Order of Interbeing (OI)

Name: Lotuses in the Mud
Description: Focused on recovery for those impacted by substance abuse. For more info, see “Mindfulness Recovery for Loved Ones” on Facebook.

Name: Majestic Oak Sangha
Description: Guided meditation and silent sitting meditation, monthly recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Two locations, in person.

Name: Mindfulness in Healing Sangha
Description: Compassionate listening and loving speech are the cornerstones of our sharing practice. Combined with mindfulness practice, we are inspired to participate in our own wellbeing. From this, we can learn to eliminate ill-being and experience freedom from suffering. Guided meditation and relaxation exercises help promote a calm, clear mind and a peaceful, loving heart. We learn to see our challenges just as they are.

Name: MotherRoot Sangha
Description: Only offering Days of Mindfulness online.

Name: Mt. Shasta Summer Sangha
Description: We meet from May through October.

Name: Mud and Lotus Sangha
Description: Our Sangha focuses on a different theme each month and Dharma sharing and discussion in the Plum Village tradition

Name: Northern California Sangha Directory
Description: Several resources for Northern California and SF Bay Area sanghas are available at this website, including a list of all Northern California sanghas and dharma teachers in the Plum Village tradition, the Norcal Sangha news/announcement list, and the Metta Sangha Bay Area discussion list.

Name: One Love One Heart Sangha
Description: Online sangha that has a different theme each week. Everyone is welcome, especially friends from the Global Majority.

Name: Parting Clouds Sangha
Description: Monthly and seasonal in-person practices of sitting, eating, and slow walking meditation. Please email truefloweryentu@gmail.com for more info

Name: Peace In Our Hearts Mindfulness Circle
Description: Peace in Our Hearts Mindfulness Practice Circle- This practice is inspired by the teachings and wisdom of the Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh and the Plum Village Tradition of Engaged Buddhism. We respect and encourage diversity and welcome you with all identities you hold. We begin with 45 minutes of sitting and walking meditation. After a short break, we will enjoy a talk, or a reading followed by group sharing (dharma sharing) about our mindfulness and meditation practice and how it influences our daily life and our interactions with the world around us. As an important part of our practice, we endeavor to create trust within our circle and hold in confidence what is shared to encourage speaking from our heart and listening to each other. We do not give advice nor engage in a debate. Dharma sharing is a practice in deep listening and loving speech. Please review the Peace in Our Hearts Sitting Group Sharing Guidelines. We acknowledge and pay gratitude to the Tilhini -Northern Chumash people on whose ancestral and unceded land we hold our practice.

Name: Peaceful Heart Sangha
Description: We are a long-time Sangha practicing in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition. We meet on Zoom, hybrid when possible.

Name: Potluck Sangha
Description: We usually meet via Zoom, in person once per month. For over 25 years, we have welcomed newcomers because we understand that at one time, we, too, were newcomers to Thich Nhat Hanh’s transformative teachings.

Name: Radiant Heart Sangha
Description: Tahoe community practicing Wednesdays 7:30a-8:30a, with seasonal retreats and monthly recitation of The Five Mindfulness Trainings, in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh's engaged Buddhism.

Name: River Oak Sangha
Description: The River Oak Sangha has been meeting continuously since 1991. Our sangha is associated with Deer Park Practice Center founded by Vietnamese Zen monk Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet in the Meditation Pavilion, Center for Spiritual Living.

Name: Singing & Hugging Sangha
Description: Plum Village practice with sitting meditation, walking meditation. We watch a video Dharma talk and then have Dharma sharing. We end with singing and hugging meditation, then tea and companionship. All are welcome. Just call or text Bev for location or Zoom link. We are just a few blocks from downtown Petaluma. Currently, we are all  seniors,  but all ages are welcome. In person outdoors or Zoom, depending on weather.

Name: Slowly Ripening Sangha
Description: Slowly Ripening Sangha practices Zen Buddhism in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. For your first visit come 15 minutes early to orient. No meditation experience needed. Begins with an hour of meditation—two sits and one walk. After a short tea break, we return for a brief ceremony, a reading or a discussion of our individual practices. There is no charge for joining us in meditation, but we do have a dana (generosity) bowl out for donations.

Name: True Home Sangha
Description: Online sangha for Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPOC) practitioners

Name: Vietnamese Lesbian Gay Bisexual Transgender Queer Sangha
Description: Our group is opened to all Vietnamese speaking LGBTQ. We recite the Vietnamese version of the Plum Village Five Mindfulness training. Tea and discussion will follow the practice. We meet on Zoom.

Name: Welcome Home Sangha
Description: All are welcome to attend our group, as a practice of openness. We learn, study & practice to support our individual & collective understanding, compassion & love. Meets at multiple houses, including corner of Mill & Barbara Streets, Ukiah, CA. During virus surges we meet online. Members are vaccinated and wear masks, as needed.

Name: Zen Meditation Good Works Sangha
Description: We have been practicing in the Plum Village tradition for over 20 years. The usual practice is to begin with a 20 minute meditation - followed by a reading and short discussion - then another 20 minute meditation. The readings we cover are are often from the Mindfulness Bell, or writings by Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Camp Metta Mindfulness Center
Description: Camp Metta Mindfulness Center found its new home in the Santa Cruz mountains during 2018 with twenty six acres of orchard grove and redwood trees. Camp Metta’s mission is to practice Mindful Living, build a Healthy Spiritual Community, and sow the Seeds of Peace in everyone. Camp Metta Sangha meets on 2nd Saturdays for meditation, dharma discussion, hiking, networking, and joyful community work.

Name: Mindfulness, Diversity, and Social Change Sangha
Description: Focus on people of color & social change activists

Name: Open Heart Sangha
Description: Practicing mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. All are welcome to join us as we enjoy sitting meditation, walking meditation, Dharma talks and Dharma sharing weekly. The last Sunday of the month, we recite the Mindfulness Trainings. Chairs, cushions, and parking passes available onsite. We've added a second Sangha at Dharma Bum Temple 4144 Campus Ave, San Diego, CA 92103

Name: Beautiful Smile Sangha
Description: This is a family Sangha for kids, ages 7-14. We meet to sit, walk, listen and practice mindful breathing, deep relaxation, walking and sitting meditation, deep listening, listening to the sounds, and also some mindful art creations.

Name: Shantideva Monastery
Description: Shantideva Monastery is a new mindfulness practice center. We are currently hosting days of mindfulness many months on the third Saturday. See norcalsangha.org for dates.

Name: Lake Tahoe Mindfulness Community
Description: Weekly sitting meditation in Plum Village tradition with a community tea following in addition to seasonal Days of Mindfulness and monthly recitation of 5 MT.

Name: Open Door Sangha
Description: Based in our home since 2000, we now meet mostly by Zoom, and in-person once per month.

Name: Sugarplum Sangha
Description: Sugarplum Sangha is an online sangha. We meet Monday through Saturday from 7:30 to 8:30 AM. Pacific Standard Time. For more information, you can contact Bridgett Wall at b.wall985@gmail.com with the subject Sugarplum, or you can text Bridgett directly at (541) 450-2007. Please state that you are interested in Sugarplum Sangha so that I know that you are not a scammer.

Name: Buckeye Sangha
Description: We practice in Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition. This is a Sangha for adults, 18 and over. We meet outside in friends backyards. Founded 1999.

Name: Ancient Forest Sangha of Humboldt Bay
Description: We practice in the Plum Village tradition, with sitting and walking meditation, Dharma readings (usually a book by Thich Nhat Hanh) and Dharma discussion. We have a monthly meeting on the first Thursdays via Zoom with Alexa Singer-Telles.

Name: Home Within Sangha
Description: We are an in-person, all-ages sangha in the Plum Village tradition. We practice sitting and walking meditation, share a reading, and finish with Dharma sharing. We are a peer-led sangha. All are welcome. Please come to the glass doors at 1187 Franklin St and someone will let you in.

Name: Palomitas de Paz Sangha (Vista)
Description: We offer both in person and virtual Sangha gatherings throughout the week. Our primary gathering is at 9:00 AM on Saturday.

Name: Compassionate Heart Sangha
Description: We meet in person at the Zen Center, but you can also join us on Zoom. Please email us for our Zoom ID and passcode.

Name: Rising Tide Sangha
Description: We are an all-inclusive, all ages, all gender preference Sangha, practicing in the Engaged Buddhist, Plum VillageTradition of Venerable Zen Master, Thich Nhat Hanh. We have been meeting weekly for 10 years nourishing sibling-hood, healing, happiness, and engaged compassionate service to our neighborhood. We study, reflect, and share our understandinag of the Dharma through our personal experience. We emphasize community building in the forms of having fun together, Pot Luck meals, and outings. We practice monthly recitations of the 5 and 14 trainings, mentor OI Aspirants, and offer direct support to the Thich Nhat Hanh Foundation. And we dont take attendance. There's always a place in our hearts for all.

Name: Peaceful Shores Sangha (La Jolla)
Description: Meets weekly as a group of committed Plum Village practitioners looking for connection and support. Leadership rotates, so the exact format of the gathering varies based on the leader's discretion. It typically includes a sitting meditation, reading, Dharma sharing, recitation, and discussion of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, walking meditation, viewing of Dharma talks by Thay or other monastics, and even mindfulness-based art projects. We also have a time to check-in with each other, sharing tea and small treats.

Name: Baby Steps Sangha
Description: A peer led group since 2009.  Established by Peggy Rowe Ward and Larry Ward.

Name: Black Mountain Sangha
Description: We meet for a 45 minute formal sitting practice followed by mindful sharing and deep listening practice at Black Mountain Center for Mindful Living in Penasquitos / San Diego, CA. We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Bodhi Youth of America
Description: BYA Mindfulness Workshop for children and teens in the Plum Village tradition

Name: Bodhi Youth Sangha Orange County
Description: BYA Mindfulness Workshop for children and teens in the Plum Village tradition

Name: Coastal Family Sangha
Description: Sitting/walking meditations and practicing mindfulness within family settings. All meetings occur in outdoor settings. All ages welcome.

Name: Compassionate Heart Sangha
Description: We are a San Diego as well as an Encinitas (or Leucadia) Sangha. Meditation, Dharma sharing, and readings from Thich Nhat Hanh. Occasional daytime and overnights retreats. We are happy to greet you and answer your questions.

Name: Flowing River Sangha
Description: We are now meeting virtually with occasional in-person meetings. We meet on Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. Interested parties can email us to get the link and join our interest list.

Name: Friendship Sangha of the Heart
Description: The Friendship Sangha of the Heart is a community of individuals who practice in the tradition of the Buddhist Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We host other mindfulness activities outside of our weekly sessions. Through our practice we aspire to bring about awareness, understanding acceptance, harmony and love. All of our gatherings are open to the public. Anyone who attends our weekly meetings, whether regularly or from time to time, is considered a member of the Sangha.

Name: Joyful Mountain Sangha
Description: The Joyful Mountain Sangha LA meets virtually on Zoom every Thursday at 7:30 pm Pacific time. We start with meditation, followed by readings and Dharma Sharing. Every 2nd Sunday we meet in a nearby park for a Mindful Hike, and we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings on the first Thursday of every month.

Name: Mango Garden Sangha (tăng thân Vườn xoài)
Description: We attended day of mindfulness at Deerpark every Sunday, attended reciting 5 mindfulness trainings and 14 mindfulness trainings every month. We meet once a month in person for sitting chanting, dharma sharing, practice deep listening, loving speech , building brotherhood sisterhood…and enjoy the mindful potluck meal. We also work in the garden at Deerpark Monastery. Our Cooking team is in active. Language: Vietnamese (English translation as requested)” dharma study group meet on zoom every Wednesday from 7:30 pm to 8:30 pm

Name: Mindfulness Beach
Description: Meeting Place: Lifeguard Tower 22. We are a growing group of mindfulness practitioners who practice sitting meditation daily in Santa Monica, CA on the beach at Lifeguard Station 22. Dress warm & bring a beach towel or blanket for sitting. We suggest using the Sundial app to pick the ideal time when you want to come sit. Individuals typically sit for 1 to 2 hours at their own comfort and convenience. Practitioners can meet and socialize after the sitting meditation and we may try to coordinate mindful walking and compassionate listening sessions if there is interest. We can discuss our favorite Thich Nhat Hanh books, or how we got started meditating. We would like to suggest that everyone reads some of Thich Nhat Hanh's books (over 30 in english) and that they also download and check out the Plum Village App as a resource. As we all become better practitioners, we'll be able to help each other more. This is really a community run initiative, we're hoping to get it started, but we have no formal leadership structure. This is all about what works for each person, giving us a chance to meet others with similar practices and giving us the opportunity to grow a community (Sangha).

Name: Nameless Sangha OC
Description: Our meetings generally include sitting and walking meditation, a Dharma reading and Dharma sharing. We've also been known to share vegan potluck meals together. We welcome practitioners of all ages and all levels of practice.  We also have daily practice support, available for 20 minutes via zoom both early AM and in the evening, 6 days per week (Sunday - Friday). Small groups attend regularly, and drop-ins are welcome.

Name: Pasadena Tranquil Lotus Sangha
Description: We aim to provide a safe and intimate space where People of Color (P.O.C.), alongside white allies, can practice in the tradition of ThichNhat Hanh. Each week we sit for around 30 minutes, listen to a dharma sharing from a reading (such as Thich Nhat Hanh’s and other teachers' books/talks) and have a dharma discussion. We come from diverse perspectives and aspire to have sangha members feel comfortable and safe in their identities (race, ethnicity, sexuality, gender, age, dis/abilities, etc.), and to cultivate a sense of belonging and community.

Name: Really Beneficial (RB) Sangha
Description: Our Sangha is for local practioners that frequently participate in Deer Park activities and like to find ways to help support the monastery. We enjoy practicing in the Thich Nhat Hanh - Plum Village Tradition. Our weekly gathering includes meditation, reading, and Dharma Sharing.

Name: Riverside Smiling Sangha
Description: We have been meeting for 12 years - group varies from 10 - 16 people. We meet at different homes in Riverside, CA each week.

Name: Two Palms Up Sangha
Description: Come wake up with us. Please join us if who wish to practice in community, engaging the practice forms of the Mindfulness Tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. Two Palms Up Sangha welcomes all residents of and visitors to Palm Springs and our surrounding desert cities. We meet every Thursday from 1:30 to 3:00 pm. We are now a hybrid sangha, meeting both in person and on zoom. Therefore practitioners residing anywhere are welcome to join us. Please write TwoPalmsUpSangha@gmail.com for Zoom details. We do not publish the meeting zoom link in order to protect our sangha.

Name: Wabi Sabi Sangha
Description: We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. The usual format is sit/walk/sit/sutra reading or other practices/dedication of the merit. Other practices include reading and discussing Thay's books in Dharma discussion, recitation of the 5 or 14 Mindfulness Trainings, other ceremonies such as Beginning Anew, The Buddha’s Birthday Ceremony, Blessing Ceremony, Touching the Earth, metta meditation and recitation of the Heart Sutra, etc. And of course, singing!

Name: Mindfulness Parry Sound
Description: We practise guided, walking and silent meditation, read from Thich Nhat Hanh and share our Dharma. Open to people of all ages, backgrounds and experience levels.

Name: Alaberta - Thousand Trees Sangha
Description: Thousand Trees Sangha is a community based in the Plum Village Tradition and the Order of Interbeing of the Ven. Thich Nhat Hanh. It is a lay practice community in that tradition situated in Spruce Grove and Stony Plain, Alberta, Canada.

Name: Alberta - Going as a River Edmonton Sangha
Description: Going As A River Edmonton Sangha practices in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Weekly practice includes sitting meditation; walking meditation; Dharma sharing; exploration of Dharma talks, Sutras as well as other readings and commentaries; Chants and practice songs. We also share in a monthly recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings on the first meeting of each month. Please visit our website for more information and updates. Everyone is welcome!

Name: One Sky Sangha
Description: The practice of ONE SKY SANGHA will be facilitated by OI and core members practicing mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition. Both online and in-person sessions are available, serving friends on the East and West coasts of Canada. The sessions will be offered alternately in Chinese and English.

Name: British Colombia - River of the Heart Sangha
Description: Our group meets weekly. Locations rotate, please contact for current location. The format is: opening, introductions, meditation (chanting, guided meditation, silent meditation), offering of teaching and Dharma sharing. The offering of teaching varies week to week. Everyone is welcome to attend. Drop-ins are welcome.

Name: British Colombia - Sangha by the Sea
British Colombia - Waves and Water Sangha
Description: Waves and Water Sangha practices in the tradition of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We follow a practice and study schedule that focuses on teachings such as Sutras and Commentaries; Five Powers, etc.; Chants and Songs; Touching the Earth. We have an LGBTQ+ inclusive Sangha with a monthly practice based on ecological/ environmental aspects of the teachings. Currently we are meeting by Zoom and have developed a close knit Sangha that welcomes everyone.

Name: British Columbia - Kelowna Mindfulness Meditation Community
Description: We include sitting meditation, weekly Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings

Name: British Columbia - Mindfulness Community of Victoria
British Columbia - Mindfulness Practice Community of Vancouver
British Columbia - The Radiant Heart Sangha
Description: This Sangha is a closed group for those ready to practise Personal Truth, Accountability, Amends, Reconciliation & manifesting True Love into the World (as defined by #3 of The Five Mindfulness Trainings). Please visit our website for more information about our Sangha and email to join.

Name: British Columbia - Wind Island Sangha
Description: We come together for sitting and walking meditation once a week, followed by a Dharma talk or Dharma sharing. Every two weeks we recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Our sangha is LGBTQIA+ affirming and welcoming, aims to heal the wounds of racial injustice and social inequity, and follows the five contemplations by eating in such a way that reduces the suffering of living beings, stops contributing to climate change, and heals and preserves our precious planet.

Name: Dawning Light Sangha
Description: An inclusive group of inter-spiritual practitioners, practicing in the Plum Village tradition.

Name: Dharma River Mindful Living Center
Description: We are a community of residential and non-residential practitioners who practice in the Plum Village Tradition under the guidance of our resident Dharma teacher Chan Hao, who has worked with Toronto Mindfulness Practice Community and the Bodhi Sangha for many years. We practice walking meditation, sitting meditation, Dharma sharing, Beginning Anew, chanting, and recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. We have our daily practice schedule for residents of the center and we offer monthly days of mindfulness and overnight retreats for local sanghas. Our center is located on fifty-two acres of beautiful land roughly an hour and forty minutes' drive from Toronto Pearson International Airport. We chose the name Dharma River for our center because the Saugeen River runs through its property and because we 'go as a river', meaning we practice as a community.

Name: Manitoba - Two Ravens Sangha
Description: We are a family of practitioners who gather daily for sitting and walking meditation. We also attend monthly group practice in Altona, MB. at an non-denominational space.

Name: Nova Scotia - Homecoming Sangha
Description: This is a new open community group following the Plum Village Tradition of guided, sitting and walking meditation, dharma reading from Thay's books or online teachings, dharma sharing, and special monthly sessions focusing on Five Mindfulness Trainings, Touching the Earth, etc.

Name: Ontario - Bodhi Community of Mindfulness
Description: Group start in 1984, practice mindfulness in all forms: breathing, walking, eating, listening ...

Name: Ontario - Burlington Mindfulness Practice Community
Description: We use the following format: An opening, a guided meditation, 15 minutes of silent meditation, 5 minutes of walking meditation, a Dharma reading or audio, guidelines for sharing, sharing, and a closing. All are welcome.

Name: Ontario - Grand River Sangha
Description: We meet on Zoom on Monday nights

Name: Ontario - Heron Croft Sangha
Description: We are a group of meditation and mindfulness practitioners and spiritual inquirers who meet weekly to practice meditation.

Name: Ontario - Kingston Sangha
Description: We come together to practice sitting meditation, walking meditation, mindful movement, Dharma sharing, and mindful singing. We also rotate through various other activities including Deep Relaxation, a reading on Buddhist teachings, Touching the Earth, and reciting the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Ontario - Mindfulness Practice Community of Hamilton
Ontario - Mindfulness Practice Community of Toronto
Ontario - Mindfulness Practice Sangha of Toronto
Ontario - Ottawa Pagoda Sangha
Description: Our Sangha’s senior Dharma teacher is Vinh Nguyen (Chan Ngo), ordained as a member of the Order of Interbeing in 1987 and received the Lamp Transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh in Plum Village in 1994. In 2014 three more Dharma teachers from our Sangha, Andre Vellino, Mihaela Andronic, and Laureen Osborne received the Lamp Transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh in Plum Village.Newcomers to our Sangha, please read the Practices page and our 2016 Summer brochure about our Sangha. Please consult the new current schedule for details.

Name: Ontario - Precious Circle Sangha
Description: A small group of meditators

Name: Ontario - Pura Vida Sangha
Description: Weekly meditation practice where we take turns reading from a written work by Thich Nhat Hanh, sitting meditation for 20 minutes, another shorter reading, walking meditation, Dharma sharing, reading of The Five Mindfulness Practices, closing.

Name: Ontario - Qi Wellness Sangha
Description: A small sangha who practice daily sitting and walking meditation and teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. Breathing in, I know I am breathing in. Breathing out, I know I am breathing out.

Name: Ontario - Tăng Thân Từ Hải (Ocean of Loving Kindness Sangha)
Description: Join us for our monthly gathering, held on Sunday from 9:30am-2:30pm, featuring:- Meditation and recitation of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings- Dharma talks- Lunch- Tea and Dharma sharing- *Special guest sharing: Live insights from monastics_ (occasional)- *Fun and learning for kids: Children's activities_ (ages 2+)Come together with us once a month in love, nurturing, and peace, supporting each other on the path to happiness. RSVP by text to help us prepare.

Name: Ontario - The Waterloo Sangha
Description: Sitting meditation, monthly talks by Thay and Plum Village monastics, Dharma sharing, studies of the Five and Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings. The sangha is Vietnamese speaking. We will be happy to accommodate English speaking practitioners.

Name: Ontario - True Peace Toronto
Description: Mindfulness meditation in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh in Room 208 (Main Activity Hall); open to students and faculty of all backgrounds, traditions and experience levels.

Name: Ontario - True Peace Toronto
Description: Meditation at Miles Nadal Jewish Community Centre; open to people of all ages, backgrounds and experience levels.

Name: Quebec - Beloved Community Sangha
Description: A community focused group dedicated to the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh and the essence of cultivating beloved community. We will do sitting meditation, listening to dharma talks and dharma discussion/sharing. We will meet in bi-weekly in person, in our apartment in Villeray (with a cat). Please email or text if you intend to come for the full address. Thank you!

Name: Quebec - Centre de pratique de la Pleine Conscience de Québec (La Sangha du Sentier de laRivière)
Description: Meditation evenings are held in French.We host two meditation sessions a week, a dozen Days of Mindfulness a year and a two-day retreat every March.

Name: Quebec - Le Village des Erables
Description: Le Village des Érables a été fondé en 1985 par la Société bouddhique Les Érables avec la conviction que le bouddhisme, tel qu'il est enseigné et pratiqué selon la tradition du maître Thich Nhat Hanh, peut apporter à tous de nombreux bénéfices.

Name: Quebec - Maison de Pleine Conscience - Institut de Pleine Conscience Appliquée de Montréal
Description: Online only. sitting/walking meditation, monthly talks by Thich Nhat Hanh or Plum Village monastics, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five and Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings)

Name: Quebec - Rivière de la Compassion
Description: En français

Name: Quebec - Sangha de l'Espoir
Description: Rencontre de pratique de la méditation assise et marchée, lecture de textes (incluant 5 entraînements à la pleine conscience et analyse de sutra) et partage du dharma.

Name: Quebec - Sangha de l'Estuaire
Description: En français

Name: Quebec - Sangha de la Maison Rose
Description: In-person meditation practice in the Plum Village tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh for members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community. We welcome those who are new to the Plum Village tradition and those new to mindfulness and meditation practices in general. Sangha meetings provide a safe, healing, connected space for queer community members to practice together through sitting meditation, readings/videos, and Dharma sharing. Meetings are conducted in English, with a goal of bilingualism as our group and language capabilities grow.

Name: Quebec - Sangha des Îles de la Madeleine
Description: Mardi à 5-375, route 199 Fatima; dimanche au 1268 Chemin du Bassin

Name: Quebec - Sangha du coeur
Description: During every meeting, we practice : sitted guided meditation, walking meditation, QiGong movements, lecture of Dharma and Family sharing.

Name: Quebec - Sangha du St-Maurice
Description: Weekly meditations

Name: Saskatchewan - Saskatoon Community of Mindful Living
Description: Our weekly practice at the Unitarian Centre is now hybrid and includes sitting, walking meditation, singing, dharma reading or video, and dharma sharing. We have regular recitations of the 5 Mindfulness Trainings, yearly retreats, and several days of mindfulness each year.

Name: Wake Up Saskatoon
Description: Hoping to start a Wake Up group in Saskatoon

Name: Waves and Water Sangha
Description: Please visit our website to get a sense of our Sangha. All are welcome!

Name: Abundant Earth Sangha
Description: Guided sitting meditation, walking meditation, dharma sharing, eating meditation.

Name: Bankstown Mindfulness Practice Centre in Sydney (BMPC Sydney)
Description: Open to all ages to learn and practice Plum Village teachings. The centre operates four terms per year, 8 weeks per term. Students required to enroll at the beginning of each term. Due to COVID19, BMPC Sydney operated online since 2020. Still 4 terms per year. In addition, a Virtual Sangha was established on WhatsApp. Members can sign in at 6am Sydney time, every day, to practice sitting together for 45 minutes.

Name: Beginners Meditation Gold Coast
Description: Emily welcomes you to her weekly beginners meditation; with Emily’s infectious energy and calming vibes, we aim to create the perfect atmosphere for meditation magic.We welcome anyone with an open mind who's interested in learning about buddhist meditation taught by Thich That Hanh.Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh is a global spiritual leader, poet, and peace activist, renowned for his powerful teachings and bestselling writings on mindfulness and peace.What to expect:music upon arrivalguided meditationa short teachingtea meditationfinish up with a chat, a laugh, with tea & snacks provided.This event is free and is held every Sunday, 6:00pm-8:00pm, Mudgeeraba

Name: Big Sky Sangha
Description: Please join us for our weekly practice of sitting meditation, walking meditation, readings and recorded teachings and dharma sharing. Everyone is welcome and we hope to see you soon.

Name: Footsteps Sangha
Description: Footsteps Sangha is a meditation group that practices in the Plum Village tradition established by Vietnamese Zen Master, Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet regularly for sitting and walking meditation, and Dharma study, practice and sharing. All faiths and lineages, and those who seek to to deepen their compassion and loving-kindness through meditation and practice, are welcome.

Name: Going Home Sangha
Description: Sitting meditation, Sutra chanting, The Insight That Brings Us to the Other Shore chanting, Dharma Talks listening from our Master; Zen songs chanting, Practice sharing

Name: Lotus Bud Sangha
Description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, our teacher is Vietnamese Zen Buddhist monk Thich Naht Hanh (Thay) who passed away in January 2022. Thich Naht Hanh is one of the most prominent spiritual teachers of the 20th century. He was a peace activist, poet, author and most importantly a sangha builder. His teachings about mindfulness are unsurpassed. Lotus Bud Sangha was established by our dear Vietnamese dharma teachers in the 1980s who wanted to share this practice with the Vietnamese community and the wider Australian community. From those small but powerful beginnings we have a number of lay sanghas in Sydney and now our own meditation centre Mountain Spring Monastery at Bilpin.We would love to have you practice with us. What is practicing you may ask? In our sangha (community of meditators) we practice sitting and walking meditation, learn about the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and share about our experiences on the path of practice. We welcome beginners and experienced meditators as we learn from each other wherever we are in our practice. The group of regular facilitators at Lotus Buds are experienced meditators in the Plum Village tradition. We have been taught and guided by dharma teacher John Barclay who received the lamp transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh. John has been leading the sangha for many years, by teaching the dharma and mentoring many of us. He is also a Buddhist scripture teacher to primary and secondary students in Sydney. Meditation can be challenging at times however being in a sangha supports our practice and makes it easier. Being in a sangha with friends with shared values and a shared practice brings us joy and gives us energy. With weekly practice and spiritual friendships the path becomes easier and more beautiful.Each Wednesday we practice sitting and walking mediation, recite trainings, or explore a teaching and share our reflections. Most importantly we learn about how meditation and the Plum Village practices can help us in our daily lives. Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings help us to transform our suffering so we can become more peaceful and happy. Wherever you may be in your meditation practice you are welcome to join us.

Name: Melbourne River Sangha - Birrarung
Description: This community was establised since 2010 by Brother Chan Hy Mac and Brother Chan Hy Son (Br Mountain). We meet in person. We practice sitting, walking, monthly talks, sutra reading and study, total relaxation, touching the earth, mindful movements, recite and observe the 5 Mindfulness Trainings. We also have Day/weekend of Mindfulness every 2-3 months. Its for all ages and everyone is welcome.

Name: Nang Mai Sangha
Description: Vietnamese speaking only

Name: Ocean Zen Community of Mindful Living
Description: Ocean Zen Community of Mindful Living practices in the Plum Village Tradition, meeting for sitting meditation, dharma sharing, sutra study, and recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Our Sangha is led by Order of Interbeing members (ordained students of Thich Nhat Hanh), who are also committee members of Plum Village (Communities of) South Australia. Our little Sangha regularly ‘mixes in’ with sister Sanghas.

Name: Ruby Saltbush Sangha
Description: Ruby Saltbush Sangha (western Adelaide) meets on second Sunday of each month for indoor Sitting Meditation at Birkenhead, and on fourth Sunday of each month for outdoor Walking Meditation by the River Torrens at Kidman Park.

Name: Smiling Hearts Sangha
Description: We are currently not accepting new members. Please check back at the beginning of 2025 for any updates. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause. We meet most weeks via zoom. Zoom links are sent out weekly as they change depending on who is hosting. We usually enjoy sitting, a teaching or reading, Dharma sharing and walking meditation.

Name: Solidity and Freedom Sangha
Description: Vietnamese (Vung Chai Thanh Thoi)

Name: Sunflowers in the Breeze
Description: Our Sangha meets both in person and online. For an up to date monthly program please email the contact address below. We practice sitting and walking meditation, Dharma sharing and recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings monthly. We also have a monthly book club and use texts by Thich Nhat Hanh and other Plum Village Monastics to guide our practice. All are welcome to join with us.

Name: Tranquil Hill Sangha
Description: Once a month gathering at 9.30 am socialising opportunity with tea etc. Program starts in at 9.45am. Concludes 11.45am light lunch generally provided. After lunch, a Dharma talk and discussion is available. Extended Program concludes by 2pm.

Name: Upeksha Sangha
Description: We practise mindful breathing, indoor mindful walking, Dharma sharing and either watch Thay teaching on a DVD or read from one of his books.

Name: Opal Sangha Clare
Description: We are a friendly, local group meeting for mindful meditation and discussion in the Plum Village tradition. We are a new and (currently) small group in a small town in Clare, South Australia. Everyone is welcome, whether you are new to Buddhism or an old hand! We try to meet monthly, usually on a weekend, for about 1.5 hours.

Name: Aberdeen, Scotland - Touching The Earth Sangha
Description: We are a very friendly, welcoming group. We usually start our meetings by watching some teaching from Plum Village, then do walking meditation, sitting meditation and Dharma discussion. We finish with lunch and those who can stay bring a vegetarian/vegan dish to share.

Name: Ascot UK Sangha
Description: Silent Meditation

Name: Birmingham - The Leaves of One Tree Sangha
Birmingham Sangha
Description: This friendly group in the Plum Village Tradition meets every week, as we have for some years, for mindful sitting and walking, then we read a section of one of the books by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh. We end by sharing insights and reflections from our practice, to water our wisdom and compassion.People can join and leave the group at any time. A more structured course can be found online, called ‘Be Calm Be Happy’. This may be particularly helpful for those new to this tradition or practice. For more details please visit: www.plumvillage.uk/learn-mindfulnessYou are very welcome to ring for a conversation before joining us to find out more; phone John Newson 0121 449 3977 or Emma 07946 451 954 john.n@phonecoop.coopMeetings are currently every Wednesday at Kings Heath Meeting House, 17 Colmore Road, B14 7PE. This is opposite Kings Heath Park. Buses 11 or 35. Limited on street parking. You are invited to arrive at 7.30pm and we finish our practice at 9.15pm. Donations are welcome to cover costs e.g., £5 cash.Note that similar meetings happen on Thursdays in Bournville, if that suits you better, with Leaves of One Tree sangha.

Name: Bishop's Castle - South Shropshire Sangha
Description: We meet once a month at Priest Weston near Bishop¹s Castle or Pudleston near Leominster.

Name: Bramham - Bramham Sangha
Description: Bramham Sangha meets on Thursday evenings 7-9pm at Bramham Parish Centre. There is an option to leave around 8pm if you cannot stay the full two hours.The sessions usually start with an informal chat, followed by: • Guided meditation • Mindful walking • Silent sit • Introductions • A reading • Dharma Sharing (reflecting on our own practice).Each week different members of the group facilitate the session. This is on a purely voluntary basis, and participation is encouraged. The facilitator (or facilitation group) chooses the theme, meditation, and readings for the session. Chairs are provided, but if you use a meditation stool or cushion for sitting, please bring it with you.You are welcome to come along and give it a try. The venue we use is free so there is no cost involved. Please email if you would like to join us.If you are new to mindfulness you may like to attend a Be Calm Be Happy course run by Plum Village UK first, and then join us. https://plumvillage.uk/learn-mindfulness/

Name: Bridport - Go As A River Sangha
Description: We meet online on Tuesday evenings for guided and silent meditation, readings and sharing.We also meet in person in Bridport and in Dorchester.Please email: goasariverbridport@gmail.com for more information about all our activities.Everyone is welcome.

Name: Bright Spirit Sangha
Description: Welcome… we are so happy that you may come and join us. We are a friendly, open small group who meet fortnightly on Wednesdays from 6.45pm to 8pm via Zoom. We enjoy meditation in Thich Nhat Hanh’s simple and beautiful tradition. We also explore all aspects of world compassionate traditions and how engaging in mindfulness meditation can help our lives become more peaceful and calm. You are most welcome to join us for tea and meditation on a Wednesday evening.

Name: Brighton - Pebbles Sangha
Description: A long-established popular sangha, founded in 1998

Name: Bristol - White Clouds Sangha
Description: We meet at the Quaker Meeting House, 126 Hampton Road, Bristol BS6 6JE

Name: Bury St Edmunds - Laughing Sangha
Description: Open to all, newcomers especially welcome!

Name: Cambridge - Cambridge Interbeing Sangha
Description: We meet on Wednesday evenings for sitting and walking meditation, on the 1st Saturday of every month for outdoor walking meditation, and on selected Sundays for family-friendly Days of Mindfulness.

Name: Cardiff - Daffodil Sangha
Description: We meet about fortnightly on a Sunday for a Morning of Mindfulness , currently alternating between on-line meetings on Zoom and in person at a lovely peaceful Tibetan Buddhist Centre in Cardiff.  The morning may include  guided meditation, slow indoor walking and silent sitting, sometimes a reading or Touching the Earth, followed by dharma sharing and recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Chester - Boundless Heart Sangha
Description: Sangha is rooted in the teachings of the Buddha and we welcome people from any, or no, faith background. Whatever our beliefs, we come together in the spirit of compassion and a desire to live fully and completely in every moment of our lives. Mindfulness means ‘keeping the conscious alive to the present reality’.

Name: Chesterfield - Pomegranate Sangha
Description: The Pomegranate Sangha is inspired by the teachings and practice of Vietnamese Zen Buddhist Master Thich Nhat Hanh. Please note that the street number is not displayed – look for the Meeting House (Quakers) sign

Name: Cockburnspath - Bluebell Sangha
Description: It is not necessary to be experienced in meditation to attend a Bluebell Group Monday Meditation; beginners are more than welcome! It is worth noting that meditation and mindfulness are not specific to any religion or belief and thus can be practised by anyone at any time.

Name: Colchester - No Mud No Lotus Sangha
Description: We practice in Thay’s tradition so a typical evening may include a tune in, meditation, a reading and some Dharma discussion. There are usually five or six attending, although others sometimes come and join us. Two of us have taken the Fourteen Mindfulness Trainings. The Sangha started about 12 years ago.We meet on Mondays in Wivenhoe, Colchester. All are welcome. Please email colchestersangha@gmail.com for further details.

Name: Cowes (Isle of Wight) - Peace is Every Breath Sangha
Description: Open to adults with some knowledge of meditation and mindfulness.Meetings from 1st September, will be held in Cowes weekly on Friday afternoons from 2.15 pm.Interested parties can contact Meme for further information.

Name: Cromarty, Scotland - The North Start Sangha
Description: We meet in the East Hall in Cromarty, 7pm for informal tea and discussion, 7.45 for formal practice. We hold Days of Mindfulness quarterly. All welcome. We practise engaged Buddhism in various ways including supporting the Highlands Supports Refugees group.

Name: Dorchester - Go As A River Sangha
Description: We meet online on Tuesday evenings for guided and silent meditation, readings and sharing.We also meet in person in Bridport and in Dorchester.Please email: goasariverbridport@gmail.com for more information about all our activities.Everyone is welcome.

Name: Dorchester - Still Water Reflecting Sangha
Description: The Sangha meets to practise in the tradition of Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh at a member's home near Frampton, Dorchester, Dorset.Please email for more information.Look forward to seeing you!

Name: Dumfries - EarthZen Dumfries
Description:
Our EarthZen Dumfries sangha is a small group that meets regularly together on Monday evenings on Zoom. Arrival is from 19:45 for a 20:00 start, entering  30-35 mins of silent meditation together. We walk for 5 minutes and then sit down to discuss Dharma.
We usually finish around 21:10. Our group brings interesting backgrounds together, Theravada, Tibetan and Zen among the Buddhist backgrounds as well as Christian and Hindu heritages. All are welcome to contact us via earthzendumfries@gmail.com and join in our Sesshin.

Name: Durham - Sacred Earth Sangha
Description: A warm welcome to the Durham Sacred Earth Sangha.We meet in person on Saturday mornings in a quiet location in central Durham.Meetings are facilitated by different Sangha members, and include sitting meditation, walking meditation, a passage or a talk / video from Thich Nhat Hanh or another Plum Village teacher and ‘Dharma sharing’ – an opportunity to share from the heart, and practice deep listening in a safe supportive group.We also meet online on a Wednesday evening once a month.We organise Days of Mindfulness every few months and extend the invitation to other Sanghas in the North East. The format for these days is similar but gives the opportunity to extend our practice to include outdoor walking meditation, mindful eating together and other practices such as deep relaxation.Our group and our practices are open to people of all faiths and none, experienced or new to meditation. Please do contact us if you would like further information.

Name: East Sussex - Heart of the Forest Sangha
Description: The Sangha meets weekly. We practice mindful sitting, drinking and eating and walking, singing, Dharma sharing, recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, listening and watching alks by Thay and other Plum Village monastics

Name: East Sussex - Plum Tree Sangha Hove
Description: Not meeting during COVID-19 restrictions. Please contact us for more information when it's safe to meet in person again at our community centre.

Name: Edinburgh - Wild Geese Sangha
Description: Our practice follows the teachings of Vietnamese Zen Buddhist Master Thích Nhat Hanh and is open to people of different faiths and none. You are most welcome to come and join us at one of our regular meetings or attend one of our retreats.

Name: Fife - Poppy Seed Sangha
Description: We are a warrm and welcoming group of practitioners who meet in North Fife to practise Mindfulness together in the tradition of Zen Buddhist Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. We meet in the Westbank Natural Health Centre in the beautiful village of Strathmiglo.

Name: Findhorn - Northern Lights Sangha
Description: Northern Lights Sangha holds a Mindfulness Morning every Saturday 10:00-12:30, usually at Cullerne House workshop space at Findhorn, IV36 3YY. Occasionally we use different venues, so please enquire beforehand if you plan to visit. Everyone welcome!

Name: Gilfach Goch – Red Valley Sangha
Description: The Red Valley Sangha meets in the Welsh Valleys every other Wednesday to practice mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition of Buddhism.

Name: Glasgow - Dear Green Sangha
Description: We are a warm and welcoming group who meet in person on the 1st, 3rd and 5th Monday of the month 7-8.30 pm. It is advised to arrive 10 minutes early as there is no-one to open the door once practice has started. We also have a monthly online Sangha via Zoom, meeting on the 4th Monday of the month and a weekday, Pyjama Sangha meeting at 8am via Zoom.

Name: Gloucester and Cheltenham Sangha
Description: We welcome all. Some previous practice of meditation and mindfulness is useful but not necessary, We will practice deep listening, dharma, mindful walking or gentle movement, depending on the weather. Our group will be held mostly in silence, aside from Dharma sharing.

Name: Guernsey - Gem of the Sea Sangha
Description: Our practice is that of the Plum Village Zen Community founded by Thich Nhat Hanh. Buddhists of all schools are welcome at our events, as indeed are people of any faith or no faith.

Name: Guildford - Peace is the Wey Sangha
Description: Peace is the Wey Sangha is based in Guildford, Surrey and is named after the river Wey that flows through the town. We are small friendly sangha that meet online via Zoom every Thursday at 7:15pm for a 7:30pm start (GMT). We practice together for around 90 minutes including a guided meditation, a reading, a tea meditation, sharing from the heart and deep listening (dharma sharing) and a silent meditation. Once a month we also recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings so that our practice can deepen each day. If you are new to meditation or Plum Village practice, we are happy to give support and guidance. We welcome everyone from the Guildford area, across Surrey and further afield to join our meetings for regular practice together. We also hold a quarterly Day of Mindfulness, these sometimes include a mindful and fun creative activity and also walking meditation, guided sitting meditation and a shared lunch.

Name: Guisborough - Roseberry Sangha
Description: The Sangha is not currently meeting, but updates will follow as soon as available. (February 2025)

Name: Hartland - North Devon Sangha
Description: Our Sangha has been meeting in various places in Devon since 1992, and has inspired several other Sanghas meeting in Devon. Our practice is purely Plum Village, led by UK Dharma teacher Teri West and OI member June Mitchell. We are currently offering monthly Mindful Mornings in Bideford Library on the first Saturdays each month, and occasional mornings walking on the North Devon Coast Path, to include mindful coffee and biscuit meditation at a sangha member’s home.

Name: Hastings Sangha
Description: We are a new group in Hastings. Venue to be confirmed (map location is not specific). If you are interested in being involved please get in touch.

Name: Heart of Liverpool Sangha
Description: Not meeting during COVID-19 restrictions. Please contact us for more information when it's safe to meet in person again.

Name: London - Heart of London Sangha
Description: Guided, silent and walking meditation. Readings and talks. Sharing circles. 5 mindfulness trainings. Social meetups.

Name: Heart of Lytham Sangha
Description: Welcome to Heart of Lytham Sangha.The Heart of Lytham Sangha meets in the town of Lytham on the Fylde coast. Our regular meetings include guided and unguided meditations, walking meditation, readings and opportunities for dharma sharing.

Name: Heathfield (East Sussex) - Empty Meadow Sangha
Description: A meditation group for the Wealden Community.We are inspired by the teachings and practice of Plum Village but are free to explore our own path too.We practice sitting and walking meditation at each meeting and welcome community members from every background and experience.We even provide a cup of tea at the end, in case you need a rest afterwards.

Name: Helston - Ocean River Sangha
Description: Ocean River Sangha meets in person near Helston on the second and fourth Wednesday evenings of the month between 6.30 and 8.30 pm.

Name: Hereford - Wave of Peace Sangha
Description: We welcome new participants.

Name: Hexham (Northumberland) - Oak Sangha
Description: The Oak Sangha meets in the town of Hexham in Northumberland. We practice Mindful Living. Our regular meetings include guided and unguided meditations; walking meditation; readings with reflection and sharing opportunities over a cup of tea.

Name: Inverness Sangha
Description: The Inverness Sangha meets every Monday evening, 18:15 to about 19:45, in a private house in Inverness. We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and enjoy the peace and companionship of our sangha meetings. Each evening includes the familiar mindful practice cycle of sitting – walking – sitting, followed by a recorded talk or a dharma reading. The evening closes with space for deep listening and speaking from the heart, where we can identify what’s alive in us in the present moment. Do get in touch with Margaret or Roland if you’d like to know more or just want to chat. We’d love to meet you and welcome you to our sangha.

Name: Ipswich Sangha
Description: Our Sangha was founded in 2001 by 6 members who had just been to Plum Village, the monastic community in France where Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh (or “Thay”) is based. (“Thay” means “Teacher” in Vietnamese)We meet (in-person and on Zoom) every Thursday evening 6.30-7.30. We are funded by donations quarterly or £2 on the night. In summer we meet at Barham Church Hall, Church Road, Barham, IP6 0PT , and in winter in each others’ homes. After a few minutes discussing business, the evening starts with a guided meditation, led in turn by the members, followed by a Tea Ceremony and a Dharma sharing. In the Dharma sharing we benefit from each other’s insights and experience of the practice. We listen deeply while members share their experiences, and refrain from giving advice. Whatever is shared is confidential.A small Dharma Study group meets every 1 or 2 months, at a member’s home, to watch a DVD of a talk by Thay.We hold a Morning of Mindfulness every 2nd Saturday of the month, 10am-1.00pm. This includes walking meditation, sitting meditation and other activities such as Touching the Earth, watching a video of Thay, Dharma sharing, etc. We all bring food and drink to share. For several years, we have organised an annual weekend retreat, in a hired centre.Any surplus donations are shared between Thay’s charities in Vietnam and the Community of Interbeing’s Practice Centre Project and Bursary Fund.Contact Isabelle for venues (isabellewen@hotmail.com or (01473)422155Our Mindfulness PracticeOur Sangha practises the art of mindfulness. Our breath is an essential element in our practice of mindfulness. It is always with us and unites our body and mind. The sound of the bell is also a central feature as it reminds us to come back to our breath and dwell in the present moment.Sitting meditation – There are many different postures recommended for sitting meditation. Thay recommends that we adopt a position where we feel comfortable and alert. This maybe cross-legged on a cushion, legs tucked underneath a stool or sitting upright on an ordinary chair. The breath should be deep and light. Our back should be straight. Our hands resting lightly in our lap or our knees.
