Our eyes can be lightly open or closed, and our mouth ideally in a gentle smile.The period of meditation begins with 3 sounds of the bell and is brought to a close with 3 sounds of the bell.Walking Meditation – When we practise walking meditation the breath is co-ordinated with our steps. When we hear the bell to start we take an in-breath and make one step with the left foot. On the out breath we take another step with the right foot. Then the cycle begins again. Throughout we are continually aware of the body.Recommended reading – “The Blooming of the Lotus”, “The Miracle of Mindfulness”, both by Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Kendal - Rolling Tide Sangha
Description: The Rolling Tide Sangha – Kendal meet in-person on the second and fourth Tuesday evening of the month. On all other Tuesday evenings, we meet online. We have Days of Mindfulness throughout the year and Mindful Fell Walking events in South Lakeland. Anyone interested in joining is welcome. In-person meetings take place at Kendal United Reformed Church Parish Rooms, 106 Highgate, Kendal, LA9 4HE. We meet around 7.20pm to settle and begin at 7.30pm, with meetings ending around 9.15pm. The building door faces towards Milne and Moser Solicitors, and is to the left of the arch way. Enter the building and turn right following the corridor to the far end of the building. On all other Tuesdays we meet online with meetings running 7.30pm (room open from 7.15pm to gather and settle) – 9pm. For details of joining online meetings please email the contact address given.

Name: Kingston Mindfulness Meditation group
Description: We meet weekly at the Kingston Quaker Centre to practise Buddhist meditation and we aspire to bring mindfulness, concentration, and insight to daily living. Our sister groups meet in Twickenham on Tuesdays and Richmond on Wednesdays.

Name: Kirkbymoorside Sangha
Description: Our meditation group practices in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.Our regular meetings include meditations, walking meditation in the garden, readings and sharing opportunities over a cup of tea.At present we meet fortnightly on Monday evenings at The Quaker Meeting House, 79 West End and currently alternate Mondays on Zoom.All ages and experiences welcome!For more information please contact us on:Noelle Thornton: noelle.thornton3@gmail.comClare Carlile: clare.carlile@mac.com

Name: Lake District - Still Waters Sangha
Description: We hold in-person meetings every Thursday in Ambleside, 6:30-7:30pm and a meeting in Cockermouth once a month. We also have an online meeting.

Name: Lancaster - Rolling Tide Sangha
Description: We share facilitation of the meetings. Usually they include sitting and walking meditation, a reading and an opportunity for mindfully sharing our thoughts. If you have never meditated before, please let us know beforehand or when you arrive, so that we can offer a few words of guidance. In addition to our regular programme, from time to time we offer Days of Mindfulness, “looking deeply” days, walks and other activities.

Name: Leeds - Red Kite Zen Sangha
Description: A small lay Zen sangha in the Plum Village tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh: Sitting meditation.Guided meditation using Plum Village resources. Mindful walks in the local countryside. Dharma sharing.

Name: Leeds InterBeing Sangha
Description: Leeds InterBeing Sangha meets on the First and Third Saturday every month from 10:30am-12:30pm (may be subject to change, please email to confirm) at Mill Hill Chapel in Leeds city centre. Doors open at 10.30am, with the practice starting after about ten minutes when everyone is settled. We also offer an online event twice per month via zoom only.

Name: Leicestershire Sangha
Description: The Leicestershire Sangha consists of two groups: the Leicester group meets in the Quaker Meeting House, Queen’s Road, Leicester.The Charnwood group meets in members’ homes mostly in the villages around Loughborough.

Name: Leigh-on-Sea - Go As A River Sangha
Description: Our evenings of mindfulness consist of guided, silent, and walking meditation, a reading of Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings and an opportunity to participate in mindful sharing. We conclude with a reading of the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Lewes - Walking in Peace Sangha
Description: Our meetings alternate, weekly, between in-person meetings in Lewes, East Sussex and online. Tuesday @7.30pm

Name: Llanidloes - Mid-Wales Sangha
Description: Sangha meeting in Llanidloes, Wales on selected Sundays from 10am to 1pm. Please get in touch for more details.

Name: London - Colours of Compassion Sangha
Description: https://www.hols.org.uk/colours-of-compassionEvery Tuesday online via Zoom, 19:00 – 20:30, with arrival at 18:55 UK timeThis group is for those who identify as BAME/Person of Colour/ Global Majority. We come together to take refuge in a space that heals the traumas of being marginalised. Through practices of deep sharing and listening we learn to celebrate our togetherness and diverse experiences, we touch a deeper sense of belonging and our shared humanity, helping us to heal the wounds of racism and deepen our understanding and compassion of our suffering.coloursofcompassion@gmail.com

Name: London - Family Sangha
Description: We are an intergenerational community for people of all ages to come together as a mindful family. Whether or not you have meditated before, we would love for you to join us for one of our days of mindfulness which we currently hold once every two months in London.Together we practise a guided meditation, mindful movements, dharma reading and sharing, in the tradition of Zen teacher Thich Nhat Hanh. Children and teens join adults for part of the day as well as having parallel programs.Please contact us to let us know if you would like to join our mailing list and find out when our next event is. People of all ages with or without children are welcome to come.

Name: London - Wednesday Sangha
Description: Zen practice and dharma sharing every Weds. Regular social meetups too, plus occasional retreats and a choir. A place of refuge, nourishment and support for those living and working in London. We aim to provide spaces where we can meet often and immerse ourselves in community.

Name: London - Dulwich Sangha
Description:
The Dulwich Sangha is a long-established sangha. It was started by Maire Pompe, our oldest member and “Holder of the Lamp” in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, but we also welcome people from all traditions.
The format of the evening is inspired by Plum Village.

We meet online every Tuesday, except in August. Two of these meetings each month are also in person. We have two shorter (7 – 8.30 pm) and two longer (7 – 9 pm) meetings, all with sitting and walking meditation and ‘sharing’. At the longer meetings we generally have a presentation as well.

We also hold a number of Mindfulness Saturdays each year.
In addition a walking meditation group meets every other Thursday from 12.30 to 2.30 pm.

Stella Chapman co-ordinates the schedules and circulates weekly Zoom links and monthly schedules, along with other relevant information. Please contact her for more details.

Name: London - North London Sangha
Description: IN-PERSON MEETINGS ON THE FIRST AND THIRD TUESDAY OF THE MONTHWe meet at the Kailash Centre in St John's Wood. In-person meetings last from 7pm to 8.30pm. We practice walking, sitting and guided meditations in a small group as well as sharing our experiences in the path. ZOOM MEETINGS DETAILS: Zoom meetings last one hour from 7pm to 8pm. They take place on the second and fourth weeks of the month.

Name: Manchester - Heart of Manchester Sangha
Description: The Heart of Manchester Sangha meets in person (not online). Our newsletter goes out monthly with more details of our meetings below. Please email heartofmanchesterstockportsanghas@outlook.com to go on the list, which does not commit you to attending. We welcome new members.We hold our our regular Sunday Sangha in a beautiful venue for which we pay rent to use. There is no fixed cost but a contribution from practitioners means we can continue to use the hall. For those who don’t carry cash or would prefer to make an online annual or monthly donation our details are as follows:The Heart of Manchester SanghaAccount Number: 41469345Sort Code: 09-01-29 All contributions are welcome.Sunday evenings (7.30–9.30 pm.) every Sunday, unless it clashes with a carol service at Christmas. The first hour or so of our practice includes guided meditation, a reading, walking meditation and silent meditation. Then an informal tea break, followed by mindful sharing – practising loving speech and deep listening.Five Mindfulness Training Meetings on the second Sunday evening of each month (7.30–9.30 pm.), reciting the trainings is woven into the shape of an evening session, as above.Monthly Saturday Morning Meetings on the second Saturday of the month we hold a session similar in form to the Sunday evenings. (10.30 am.–12.30 pm.)Days of Mindfulness three times a year, in January, May and September, we share a day in the company of one another, deepening our mindfulness practice through a range of meditations and sharing. Rough guide of programme is arrive 10.15 am. for 10.30 start, finishing at 4.00 pm. Please bring ready prepared vegetarian lunch to share. Please contact us at heartofmanchestersangha@gmail.com for more information.Solstice meetings twice a year, near to the winter and summer solstices we meet for a little longer (4.30–9.30) to enjoy a guided deep relaxation followed by an informal meal before the evening session. Please bring food for yourself and/or to share.We hold our meetings in the Chorlton Unitarian Church.

Name: Manchester - Rainbow Sangha
Description: This is a group for Plum Village practitioners who identify under the LGBTQIA+ umbrella. We meet online every Tuesday to enjoy guided and silent meditation, Dharma sharing and readings. every first Tuesday of the month we recite and contemplate the Five Mindfulness Trainings. All are welcome.

Name: Milton Keynes Sangha
Description: We sometimes hold mindful walking events, usually at the Milton Keynes Peace Pagoda. We hold additional meetings from time to time to recite the 5 mindfulness trainings and to discuss and develop our practice related to these. More information is available at our monthly meetings.

Name: Milverton - Clear Flowing River Sangha
Description: We meet every other Tuesday for an hour and a half or two hours. Please ring for more details.

Name: Mindfulness at Hinton
Description: Community run mindfulness group that has been established since 2015. We run courses, sitting groups, retreats and workshops.

Name: Morayshire - Peaceful Heart Sangha
Description: Practicing Mindfulness Meditation in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Mortock, Somerset - Dharma Bell Sangha
Description: The Dharma Bell Sangha roots itself in the Plum Village Tradition, taught by Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) and his disciples. We use Thay’s words, freely shared with us through his many books and teachings and these words support us to grow in love, compassion, understanding and awareness.The Dharma Bell Sangha is affiliated with Plum Village UK and as such some of the meditation sittings listed below are facilitated by Plum Village UK Lay Dharma teachers. Links to the practices provided by Plum Village UK can be found here: https://plumvillage.uk/Our weekly calendar looks like this:MONDAY MORNINGS: “FROM THE HEART” 08.30Offered via Facebook Live, the “From The Heart” sessions are a time where Andy shares a brief reading from Thay’s books, starting and closing with a brief meditation. From the Heart can be accessed from this page. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/558068675090521WEDNESDAY SANGHA SITTING, 18.30 – 20.00Our Wednesday night Sangha Sitting is provided via Zoom. We sit and share some of Thay’s teachings, such as working through a book together. We then meditate on what we have heard and enjoy a time of dharma sharing at the end. The link for these sessions is posted on the Dharma Bell Sangha page, usually the day before the sitting.Attending these practices does not tie you into anything, there are no conditions, expectations, obligations, or requirements and, best of all, there’s no fee! They are simply offered to support us all to progress in our path.Welcome! With a smile, Andy

Name: Newcastle - Northern Lotus Sangha
Description: Northern Lotus Sangha is an interbeing Sangha that meets on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month at ‘Earthlings, The Healing Cafe’, 94 Buckingham Street, Newcastle, NE4 5QR – http://www.earthlingsthc.co.ukWe begin at 7pm and end around 9pm.Earthlings is open before hand for delicious vegan drinks and food.

Name: Newtonmore - Goodwill Sangha
Description: A new group starting on Monday 11 December 2023 in Newtonmore, a mountain village in the Scottish Highlands.We will meet weekly on a Monday evening from 7.00 pm – 9.00 pm at Glen Grove in Newtonmore.We welcome beginners and experienced practitioners willing to learn and practice together. This group is suitable for you if you are:– a beginner or more experienced practitioner looking to establish a regular daily meditation practice.– interested in practices to nourish and cultivate wellbeing in your life.– you have an interest in meditation.For further details please email Erica – goodwillsangha@fastmail.co.uk

Name: North Devon Sangha
Description: Our Sangha began in 1992, meeting firstly at the Bishop of Exeter's Palace, then at the Quaker Meeting House in Exeter. Other sanghas were grew from this beginning in other parts of the West country. The North Devon Sangha met at members' homes for many years, until driving became unpopular with facilitators and meetings became difficult. During the pandemic the North Devon Sangha met online, taking in members from other parts, including Wales and Denmark. The Bideford Library mornings are aimed at building a new sangha meeting in person.

Name: North Walsham - The Bure Valley Sangha
Description: The Bure Valley Sangha meets on Tuesdays at 7pm. We are convenient for the market towns of Aylsham and North Walsham. Also Coltishall, Wroxham and the surrounding villages. We are approximately 10 miles north of Norwich. We are called The Bure Valley Sangha after the river Bure, one of Broadlands main rivers. Please contact Chris for venue details.

Name: Norwich - Swallowtail Sangha
Description: Our group meets on the first and third Mondays of the month, in Norwich from 7pm to 9pm. Also we meet on the second Saturday of the month for a Mindfulness walk from 9:00am. Please ask primary contact for details (locations on map are approximate).We call ourselves “The Swallowtail Sangha” after a beautiful and rare butterfly that is found in the nearby Norfolk Broads.

Name: Nottingham - Deep Roots Sangha
Description: The practice is open to people of all faiths and none. New participants are always welcome. We operate an email mailing list to let those interested know where we will be meeting each week. Please contact Lauren if you would like further information.

Name: Oakham (Rutland) - Flower Fresh Sangha
Description: The Flower Fresh Sangha is a small and friendly group which meets weekly. All welcome!

Name: Oxford Sangha
Description: We meet online for regular Sangha meetings that include a guided sitting meditation, walking meditation, Dharma reading and Dharma sharing: weekly meeting on Thursday evenings. We also meet every morning to start the day with a morning chant and meditaion.

Name: Pembrokeshire - Open Waves Sangha
Description: We are a group inspired by the teachings of Zen master Thich Nhat Hanh. We meet every Monday, via Zoom, and every Wednesday in person. These are informal sessions, where we share a guided and silent meditations, reading, mindful sharing/listening.

Name: Plymouth - Mindful Breathing Sangha
Description: Mornings of mindfulness including sitting , walking movement and eating meditations. Also weekly Zoom meetings

Name: Reading - Sunflower Sangha
Description: The Sunflower Sangha meets monthly (usually 3rd Sunday of the month) at the Dolphin Centre, Dolphin House, Whitchurch Rd, Pangbourne, Reading RG8 7DA at 19:00 – 20:30.Together we will have a check-in, guided and walking meditations, some teaching to reflect on, and time for sharing our insights and experiences with the practice (Dharma Sharing).Everyone is welcome to join our meditation evenings, whether you are a beginner or a more experienced meditator – no commitment is required.

Name: Rotherham - Cherry Tree Sangha
Description: Quiet space meditation just to simply be, currently held online. Please email Phil for zoom link.There is also a Facebook group to connect and join in discussions in between the sessions.For more information please get in touch with Phil: sit.like.a.stone@gmail.com

Name: Sangha Mynydd Cadarn – Solid Mountain Sangha
Description: Mae Sangha Mynydd Cadarn – Solid Mountain Sangha yn sangha bach sydd newydd ailddechrau cwrdd wyneb yn wyneb. Yn gyffredinol rydym yn cadw at ymarfer syml, gyda ambell sesiwn fwy ffurfiol. Rydym yn cael ein cefnogi gan egni y mynydd cadarn o’n cwmpas. Does dim angen profiad blaenorol. Cysylltwch â ni i ddarganfod mwy.Sangha Mynydd Cadarn – Solid Mountain Sangha is a small sangha just restarting in person meetings. We mainly keep to a very simple practice, with occasional more formal sessions. We are greatly supported by the energy of the solid mountain in whose orbit our sangha meets. No previous experience needed. Please get in touch to find out more.

Name: Scotland - The North Star Sangha
Description: We meet on zoom and in-person alternate weeks.Thursday evenings we meet via zoom: 7.30pm-9.00pmFriday mornings we meet in-person: 10.00am-12 middayRoughly every quarter, we hold days of mindfulness where we link with other Sanghas in the North of Scotland.All are welcome.

Name: Seaford - Meandering River Sangha
Description: The Meandering River Sangha meets formally fortnightly on a Saturday morning and sangha members are welcome to use 'Place des Amis' (a small summer house in the garden) on the other Saturday to read or practise as needed. This practice follows Tháy's teaching and explores Engaged Buddhism.

Name: Seashore Inspiration Sangha
Description: Seashore Inspiration Sangha – inspired by the Seashore – has been set up to practice mindfulness in accordance with the teachings of Vietnamese Zen Buddhist Master, Thich Nhat Hanh.Our meetings will include guided meditation, walking meditation, readings, a mindful cup of tea, deep relaxation and sharing in groups.We will also have a newsletter, retreats, events and mindful meals when the times comes.We meet on Sundays from 10:00 to 12:00 hrs.For more information please e-mail Linda: SeashoreInspirationSangha@gmail.comOur Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2352131464979613

Name: Sheffield Sangha
Description: We are currently meeting for mindfulness meditations Online, all are welcome to join us. Please check  our website for more information. We are also happy to talk if you have further questions and would like to get to know us more, before arriving at the first session.

Name: Sheringham - North Norfolk Sangha
Description: There are two groups - one which meets once a fortnight on Friday mornings in Sheringham. There is a small spin off group that meets on Wednesday mornings weekly in Bacton.

Name: Shetland - Bonhoga Sangha
Description: We are a small sangha meeting in the Tingwall area, welcoming experienced and new practitioners, whether local or visitors to the island.

Name: Singing Bell Sangha
Description: The Singing Bell Sangha roots itself in the Plum Village Tradition, taught by Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) and his disciples. We use Thay’s words, freely shared with us through his many books and teachings and these words support us to grow in love, compassion, understanding and awareness.The Singing Bell Sangha is affiliated with Plum Village UK and as such some of the meditation sittings listed below are facilitated by Plum Village UK Lay Dharma teachers. Links to the practices provided by Plum Village UK can be found here: https://plumvillage.uk/Our weekly calendar looks like this:MONDAY MORNINGS: “FROM THE HEART” 08.30Offered via Facebook Live, the “From The Heart” sessions are a time where Andy shares a brief reading from Thay’s books, starting and closing with a brief meditation. From the Heart can be accessed from this page. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/558068675090521WEDNESDAY SANGHA SITTING, 18.30 – 20.00Our Wednesday night Sangha Sitting is provided via Zoom. We sit and share some of Thay’s teachings, such as working through a book together. We then meditate on what we have heard and enjoy a time of dharma sharing at the end. The link for these sessions is posted on the Singing Bowl Sangha page, usually the day before the sitting.Attending these practices does not tie you into anything, there are no conditions, expectations, obligations, or requirements and, best of all, there’s no fee! They are simply offered to support us all to progress in our path.Welcome! With a smile, Andy

Name: South Tawton - Taw River Sangha
Description: Mindfulness and Meditation following the teachings of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh and the tradition of Plum Village practice.

Name: Staffordshire (Eccleshall) Sangha
Description: We meet monthly for a regular meeting and also for a Day of Mindfulness.

Name: Staines - Friends on the Path Sangha
Description: We are a group of lay practitioners who practise mindfulness in the Plum Village tradition and follow the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh and other teachers in the Zen Buddhist tradition.We meet online via Zoom each week, but once a month we offer the opportunity to meet in person at the house of one of our members in Staines. We also offer days of mindfulness several times a year. All are welcome to come along, whether you wish to practise with us regularly or just occasionally. Please make contact with Shirley Lunn for the Zoom link to our Monday evening meetings and for details of in-person events.

Name: Stevenage - North Herts Earth Touching Sangha
Description: A typical meeting consists of a period of music, sitting meditation, dharma talk or video clip, and a period of mindful speaking and listening.

Name: Stourbridge - Nourishing Peace Sangha
Description: We are a group of people who meet to join in meditation and share teachings on Buddhism. New members and beginners to meditation are always welcome, you can join us at any time of the year. Chairs are available but if you wish to sit on a mat or cushion please bring this with you. We remove our shoes so warm socks are a must especially in the winter! During the evening we enjoy guided meditations, slow walking meditation and silent sitting meditation. We also drink tea mindfully, listen to talks by Thich Nhat Hanh, share Buddhist readings, mindful speech and deep listening. We meet from 7:15pm to 9:15pm on the first and third Thursdays of the month. We also meet online on the 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month from 7:30pm – 8:30pm. Please arrive 5 to 10 minutes earlier so we have time to settle before we begin.

Name: Stroud Sangha
Description: A community practising mindfulness in the tradition of Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh meeting regularly in the Stroud and Nailsworth areas. Please ask primary contact for details (locations on map are approximate).

Name: Suffolk Coastal Sangha
Description: We meet weekly for meditation practicing in the Plum Village tradition. We also have a monthly Dharma sharing, choosing different texts to study. We have two Days of Mindfulness each year.

Name: Swaffham - Brambles Sangha (Mid West Norfolk)
Description: Meeting weekly in the Swaffham area.

Name: Swindon - White Clouds Sangha
Description: White Clouds Sangha in Swindon meets for mindfulness and meditation every Tuesday evening from 6:45pm to 8:45pm.  Our practice is simple, and those who are new to the group will be gently guided by the facilitator. Members of The White Clouds Sangha also meet in Bristol and Marlborough. Please see our website for more details..

Name: Tideswell (Derbyshire) - Sangha in the Peak
Description: Sangha in the Peak is a welcoming sangha which offers an opportunity for peace and calm through a series of meditations and practices based on the Plum Village tradition and Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings.We meet weekly online on Monday evenings and in person on the last Saturday and the second Thursday of the month at Litton Village Hall. Full details are available on our website: https://sanghainthepeak.org/On Mondays and Thursdays, please arrive between 7:15 pm and 7:25 pm for a 7:30 pm start. Our practice will finish by 9:00 p.m.On Saturdays, we sometimes have a silent sit from 9:30-10:20 am, when you are welcome to join at any point; then our full practice starts at 10:30-12:00 with refreshments afterwards.Please let us know if you are planning to come along to a Sangha by contacting Sophie at sanghainthepeak@gmail.com. We look forward to welcoming you.

Name: Totnes Sangha
Description: We meet weekly and also hold periodic Days of Mindfulness.

Name: Tottenham Hale - London - Seven Sisters Sangha
Description: We meet fortnightly in-person on Tuesdays at 7.30pm – 9.00pm. Please arrive from 7.15pm for a relaxed start.We welcome people of all faiths and none.Our new email address is Seven-Sisters-Sangha+owner@groups.io Future updates will be included on our website at https://seven-sisters-sangha.site123.me

Name: Twickenham Sangha
Description: In our sessions, we do a variety of practices in a mindful way including guided meditation, mindful walking, silent sitting, reading from a meditation book and sharing of practice and life.

Name: West Wight Sangha
Description: The West Wight Buddhist Group (Sangha) was formed at the beginning of 2007. The West Wight is the Western side of the Isle of Wight, situated off the Southern coast of England. There is a thriving Buddhist community on the lsland made up of a number of different groups. The West Wight group, or Sangha, is non-denominational and meets weekly to meditate and discuss the Dharma, the Buddha's teachings.

Name: West Yorkshire - Green Leaves Sangha
Description: We are an inclusive and welcoming group of people living in and around the Calder Valley in West Yorkshire. We are part of the wider international grouping of practitioners who follow the mindfulness practice and teachings of Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Whitley Bay - Peaceful Heart Sangha
Description: A small sangha in Whitley Bay in the North East of England, practicing monthly on the second Friday of every month between 19:30 – 20:45. We meet at the Azure Therapy Centre.Please email for further details.

Name: Whitstable and Broadstairs - Sea of Calm Sangha
Winchester Sangha
Description: Please ask about exact address!

Name: Wrexham (Berwyn) - The Heart of Transformation Sangha
Description: A Plum Village UK sangha that meets weekly inside Berwyn Prison.  This sangha is the fruit of outreach work by UK Dharma Teacher and Prison Chaplain Dene Donalds.  Dene, assisted by other Dharma Teachers and UK Order members has established a regular meditation practice session for inmates.  Several inmates have received the five mindfulness trainings as a result of this outreach work.

Name: York Sangha
Description: York Sangha practises in the Plum Village tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh, following his emphasis on mindful living and engaged Buddhism. Our Sangha is open to people of all faiths, or none, and we welcome newcomers.

Name: Tunbridge Wells Sangha
Description: An informal mindfulness practice and reflection group set up to support anyone interested in exploring how mindfulness practice can support them in their daily lives. Practice and teachings will draw on the plum village Buddhist tradition but sessions open to all faiths or none.

Name: Anam Cairde Sangha (Soul Friends)
Description: Following the practices of Thich Nhat Hanh’s Plum Village, the Day of Mindfulness includes sitting meditation, mindful walking (outside usually), lunch (soup provided) and deep relaxation. Dharma sharing is the practice of mindful speech and deep listening where we share our experience of the practice.All are welcome. We are open to all faiths and none, whether you are new to mindfulness or a seasoned practitioner.

Name: Donabate Buddist Sangha
Description: A new but soon to be flourishing sangha in the tradition of Plum Village. Hoping to endear the people of Donabate to the practice of deep listening and compassionate speech. Hoping to provide a practice to help the community deal with strong emotions and practise beginning anew and shining light.

Name: Fresh Morning Sangha
Description: We meet Tuesday & Thursday mornings, via Zoom which you may need to download to your device in advance (audio only; no video). The Zoom link is https://zoom.us/j/568796923.  join call to connect together and share the focus/aspiration of our day / 7am – bell to invite guided or silent sitting /7.20am – bell to close meditation with closing words from facilitator. We leave the call in silence, taking the calm energy with us into our day.

Name: Kildare Sangha
Description: Includes guided and silent meditation, mindful movements, dharma sharing. Minimum contribution of €5 to cover venue costs. Blankets and chairs provided.

Name: Old Heart New Heart Sangha
Description: We have meditation, followed by eating mindfully, a walk in the Monastic village, then meditation and dharma discussion in the afternoon. Please bring lunch /tea and suitable clothing/footwear for outdoor walking. Small donation (suggested 10 Euro) for use of room. If you wish to join us, you must phone or email ahead of time to reserve a place as space is limited

Name: Open Circle Sangha
Description: Plum Village inspired mindfulness practice offering: guided and silent sitting meditation, walking meditation, mindful living practices, Dharma sharing, laughter, five mindfulness trainings recitation and days of mindfulness. Contribution of €5. People with some experience can join us any time, people new to mindfulness meditation can join us on the first Monday of the month for an orientation to mindfulness.

Name: Open Heart Sangha
Description: €5 donation suggested (for those who can afford it)

Name: Sangha Na Núll
Description: All ages, visitors and level of experience welcome. We start the morning with a guided meditation, then walking meditation, sitting meditation, a reading from one of Thich Nhat Hanh books and then a dharma sharing. We spend most of the morning in noble silence apart from the dharma sharing and goodbyes. No donation is needed.

Name: Solas Gheal Sangha
Description: We practice to deepen our experience of mindfulness, peace, compassion and understanding by engaging in sitting meditation, walking meditation and other mindfulness practices inspired by the tradition of Plum Village and Zen Teacher and Peace Activist Thich Nath Hahn. Our meetings are open to everyone and a contribution towards costs is welcome. For new members and visitors, please arrive 10 minutes early for orientation. We also frequently offer days of mindfulness usually on Sundays. Please contact for up to date details.

Name: Sonas Sangha (for Children)
Description: Sonas meets monthly in Dublin to support the practice of children. It's aimed at 7-12 year olds. Through sitting, walking, teatime and games, we will cultivate our peace and joy and learn to take care of our difficult emotions.

Name: Still Water Sangha
Description: An all-ages Sangha practising in the Plum Village tradition, open to people of all faith traditions, cultures, ethnicities and gender identities. No prior experience of meditation needed. Please arrive 10 minutes early for a prompt start

Name: Suaimhneas Mindfulness Group
Description: Dublin Mindfulness Group practicing in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. A Day of Mindfulness would include sitting meditation, deep relaxation, mindful walking, dharma sharing, and enjoying tea together. Open to all faiths and none; whether you are new to meditation or a seasoned practitioner. €10 suggested donation to cover cost of room and expenses. Contact us via email/ check our Facebook Page or if you would like to go on our mailing list, we will confirm date of next Sangha.

Name: Solas Gheal Sangha
Description: We practice to deepen our experience of mindfulness, peace, compassion and understanding by engaging in sitting meditation, walking meditation and other mindfulness practices inspired by the tradition of Plum Village and Zen Teacher and Peace Activist Thich Nath Hahn. Our meetings are open to everyone and a contribution towards costs is welcome. For new members and visitors, please arrive 10 minutes early for orientation. We also frequently offer days of mindfulness usually on Sundays. Please contact for up to date details.

Name: Sangha de la Yerba Mate - Pachamama
Description: This group is open for beginners to advanced practitioners and families who are practising with their children between 6 to 12 years. Together we enjoy Plum Village tradition practices. The group is facilitated by Christina Buckley and Tamara, the master of the bell. Please bring your lunch box, flask or drink, pencil and notebook and a blanket. Dana (donation of any amount) is gratefully accepted to cover the online sangha for the Spanish speaking community.

Name: Buddha Dhyana Kendra
Description: We conduct weekly retreats in which participants stay in the monastery and practice mindfulness, free of charge. Activities: Sitting / Walking meditation, videos by Thich Nhat Hanh, Dharma sharing, Recitation (We have created local language chantings - kannada) and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings

Name: Good Life Village
Description: We practice sitting walking meditation, we play videos of thay, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings with a group of people on a daily basis. There are visitors as well as residents at Hedathale, Nanjanagud Taluq.

Name: Awa Pākato ~ Flowing River Whanganui Mindfulness Sangha
Description: Dharma sharing, sitting meditation, walking meditation, reciting and observing the Five Mindfulness Trainings, singing Plum Village songs, guided meditation, days of mindfulness with recorded dharma talks & mindful eating

Name: Centre of Mindful Living Auckland
Description: CML Auckland (previously known as Long White Cloud Sangha) has been practicing together for over 20 years. During lockdown, we are meet weekly via Zoom to practice sitting meditation, sharing readings from teachers in the Plum Village tradition, and Dharma sharing.Please contact us to find out more or join our sangha. We look forward to hearing from you.

Name: Christchurch Community of Mindful Living
Description: We are a local group of people who meet together regularly to support one another in the practice, we welcome new and experienced folk alike. The group is facilitated by Brendan who lived in Plum Village from 1990 to 2003 and was ordained as a dharma teacher by Thây in 2003. Please see the website for detailed information on meeting times and places

Name: Hamilton East Mindfulness Community
Description: we meet fortnightly on a wednesday evening from 7-9 pm. we parctice walking meditaion, sitting meditaion and finish with a dharma study topic

Name: Mindful Living Cambridge
Description: We welcome people to practice walking and sitting meditation, Dharma sharing, mindfulness movements, deep relaxation, readings from Thich Nhat Hanh's books, Plum Village dharma talks, Five Mindfulness Trainings, singing songs from PV and Dharma Gaia Mindful Living Community, and we share meals mindfully together a few times a year.

Name: Mindfulness Practice Christchurch
Description: We meet as a sangha on Thursday mornings and practice sitting meditation, dharma sharing and mindful movements together. We also hold a Day of Mindfulness from time to time.

Name: Wellington Centre of Mindful Living
Description: We enjoying meeting sitting/walking meditation, tea ceremony, Dharma sharing, recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, readings and Dharma talks.

Name: Belfast - Leaves of One Tree Sangha
County Down - Lotus Blossom Sangha
Description: Plum Village-inspired Mindfulness Meditation Group. One hour: guided meditation, walking meditation, silent meditation: followed by up to 20mins mindful discussion and/or readings. No charge at present, although biscuits and treats for ‘tea’ afterwards always welcome.

Name: Moira - Gaiatree Family Sangha
Description: The families that are currently part of the Sangha have children ranging in age from 5-15y. We usually share a meditation together, do some mindful walking and playing, share a cup of tea and some snacks and dharma sharing is often informal due to the age range in the Sangha. It’s a wonderfully supportive circle.

Name: Newtownabbey - Tall Trees Sangha
Description: We practice sitting, walking and Dharma sharing. We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Whitehead - Waves of One Sea Sangha
Description: We meet upstairs in the Community Centre in Whitehead, Co. Antrim

Name: Boat of Compassion Sangha
Description: We are Plum Village Philippines, Boat of Compassion Sangha. We practice Thay's tradition since 2011. We practice Mindfulness both onsite and online (Zoom). We usually do Sitting Meditation, Walking Meditation, Total Relaxation, Listening to Dharma Talks (Plum Village App YouTube) and Dharma Sharing. Sometimes we practice Mindful Movements and Tea Meditation.We also recite the 5 Mindfulness Trainings every 4th Tuesday of the Month. (Online)

Name: Plum Village Lisbon Sangha
Description: Sangha meetings may include reading the five Mindfulness Trainings, guided sitting meditations, silent sitting meditations, walking meditations, a reading from a Thich Nhat Hanh book or viewing a dharma talk, and dharma sharing.

Name: Joyful Garden Sangha
Description: We practise together at a monthly weekend Day of Mindfulness as well as weekday group sessions, and organise retreats when conditions permit. Please follow our Facebook or website for announcements and registration details.

Name: Baobab Sangha
Description: Sitting meditation, Dharma sharing, recitation and observation of the Five Mindfulness trainings

Name: Smiling Lotus Sangha - Thailand
Description: All are welcome

Name: Northamptonshire - Three Jays Sangha
Description: We will share sitting mindfulness practice, walking and movement meditation, dharma and deep listening, observation of the 5 mindfulness trainings.

Name: Intersein Sangha Wien (Vienna)
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation and mindful conversation, as well as - from time to time -other exercises of Intersein tradition.(A) central topic: Implementation of practice in everyday life.We also have a so called study group, where we meet once a month to talk about a book of Thich Nhat Hanh we are reading in between chapter for chapter.Wir praktizieren Sitz- und Gehmeditation und achtsames Gespräch, sowie hin und wieder auch andere Übungen aus der Intersein Tradition.(Ein) zentrales Thema: Umsetzung der Praxis im AlltagWir habe außerdem eine Studiengruppe, in der wir einmal im Monat über ein Buch von Thich Nhat Hanh sprechen, das wir in der Zwischenzeit lesen - Kapitel für Kapitel.

Name: Sangha Innsbruck
Description: * sitting/walking meditation* reading and discussing dharma texts* dharma sharing

Name: Achtsamkeitstag in Heckenbeck
Description: We organize a Day of Mindfulness every second month. Furthermore there is a weekly silent meditation.

Name: BIPoC Sangha Berlin
Description: We are a BIPoC (Black, Indigenous and People of Colour) only sangha group. We practice in both English and German.We meet regularly for peer-facilitated practice, where we enjoy sitting and walking meditation as well as dharma sharing. Occasionally we practice singing meditation, reciting 5 MTs. mindful movements or deep relaxation. Afterwards we have an informal get together with food.

Name: Bluete der Achtsamkeit
Description: We meet weekly since 2002

Name: Buddhistische Meditation Ulm
Description: Meeting place: Yoga- und Naturheilpraxis Riegert (Hinterhaus)

Name: Dasein Konstanz Sangha
Description: Tea meditation, inner weather sharing, sitting and walking meditation, dharma sharing

Name: Eine Blume am Weg - Sangha Münnerstadt
Description: We are a small sangha and practice sitting, walking and sharing partly in nature

Name: Freiburg - Wildrosen Sangha
Description: We practice sitting, singing, smiling and sharing. Often we enjoy walking meditation along the small river nearby our location. You are welcome to our meetings - no need to bring anything. Cushions and mats are available.

Name: Friedenshof
Description: We have days of mindfulness every second month, weekly meditation-evening

Name: Haus Siddharta Zentrum für die Praxis der Achtsamkeit
Description: Bitte nur werktags von 9-12 und 16-17 Uhr anrufen

Name: Hergatz/Wohmbrechts
Description: 3 km von Wangen im Allgäu entfernt

Name: Holistic Virtual Sangha
Description: We meet (online) and practice meditation, Dharma sharing, breathing and mindfulness. We also practice some specific exercise to introduce mindfulness into normal life.We study Buddhism, in the Thich Nhat Hahn and Tibetan Tradition, mainly in its intercultural connection to our society.

Name: Intersein Sangha Rosenheim
Description: Wöchentlicher Praxisabend in Präsenz in Rosenheim: Jeden Donnerstag, 19.30 -21.00 Uhr (an Feiertagen nach Absprache). Unkostenbeitrag: 1,50 €. Bitte melde Dich spätestens einen Tag vor Deinem Besuch bei uns an.Wir treffen uns in der Schillerstraße 33 in Rosenheim. Komm am besten in bequemer Kleidung, in der Du gut sitzen kannst. Es sind keine Vorkenntnisse erforderlich, die Meditationen werden angeleitet.

Name: Intersein Sangha Regensburg
Description: Meditations- und Achtsamkeitspraxis in der Intersein-Tradition. Für die Adresse, bitte Kontakt aufnehmen!

Name: Karlsruhe Sangha
Description: We are a small Sangha meeting once a Week to meditative and read texts written by Thay. We practise walking meditation and dharma sharing.You are welcome to join.Wir sind eine kleine Sangha in der Plum Village Tradition die einmal die Woche zusammen kommt um Texte von Thich Nhat Hanh zu lesen, gemeinsam zu meditieren und Gehmeditation zu praktizieren. Wir tauschen uns aus über die Texte und unsere Praxis.Fühle dich herzlich willkommen.

Name: Kirchblütensangha
Description: Wir treffen uns zweiwöchentlich für gemeinsames Meditieren und Gehen sowie achtsames Teilen.

Name: Meditationskreis in der Tradition von Thich Nhât Hanh
Müggelsee Sangha
Description: We meet to practice sitting and walking meditation together and share about our practice our struggles and our happy moments.

Name: Münster Sangha
Description: We are an active community of mindfulness practitioners, inspired by the teachings of Zen Master and peace activist Thich Nhat Hanh. We gather together to practice sitting and walking meditation, share our joys and difficulties during Dharma Sharing, and to encourage each other on the path of practice. During these evenings we regularly drink tea together and sing songs accompanied by guitar. Our group welcomes practitioners of all traditions and experience levels to practice mindfulness in comunity. It is necessary that you speak at least a basic level of German.Currently, we are a stable group of 5-6 people ranging from anywhere between 25 and above 40 years of age. However, because we move to a new and bigger room this summer, we are in the process of raising awareness of our sangha, so that we can practice with even more friends. The new room will be only a few minutes from our current room and more towards the direction of Münster's city centre.

Name: Papaya Sangha Frankfurt
Description: We do sitting, walking meditation, recitation and Dharma sharing

Name: Peaceful Steps
Description: Sitting Meditation, Walking Meditation, Dharma Sharing … Guided Beginner Group for People with serious Health Issues (Cancer, Depression)

Name: Quelle der Achtsamkeit
Description: Wir freuen uns sehr, wenn du eine Freundin/ein Freund in unserer Sanghafamilie werden möchtest. Wir lieben Achtsamkeit und nehmen ganz regelmäßig und zuverlässig teil.

Name: Quelle der Friedvollen Interaktion - Eschweiler
Description: Wir sind eine junge Sangha; treffen uns für Walking Meditation & Dharma Sharing.

Name: Rheinhessen Sangha
Description: Wir freuen uns auf Ihr Interesse an unserer Sangha.Wir haben uns im Februar 2022 gegründet.

Name: Sangha Augsburg
Description: Ablauf der Meditationsabende:Zwei Runden Sitzmeditation, davon eine stille und eine oft angeleitete Meditation (je ca. 20 bis 25 Min.), unterbrochen von ca. 10 Min. Gehmeditation.Nach der Meditation wird ein Text gelesen und wir üben uns danach in der Praxis des tiefen Zuhörens und achtsamen Sprechens.Zum Abschluss singen wir noch einige Lieder.Immer am ersten Dienstag im Monat rezitieren wir die 5 Achtsamkeitsübungen.

Name: Sangha Berlin-Wilmersdorf
Description: Sitting/walking meditation, Dharma sharing, mindful body awareness, integration of mindfulness into everyday life

Name: Sangha Berlin-Zehlendor
Description: We've been meeting every wednesday evening for 2 1/2 hours. There is morning sitting on monday from 8.-9.00, and several days, retreats or enjoyable activities together during the year.

Name: Sangha Buchenberg im Allgäu
Description: Meditation im gemütlichen Rahmen mit klarer Ausrichtung.Jederzeit offen für Interessierte! We practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

Name: Sangha der Freude in Mainz
Description: Wir haben uns im April 2023 gegründet und treffen uns 2 oder 3 Mal im Monat. Wir freuen uns über jeden, der uns kennen lernen möchte und mit uns praktizieren möchte

Name: Sangha Düsseldorf-Nord
Description: We practice sitting and walking meditation, read a text by Thich Nhat Hanh (or another spiritual teacher sometimes) and share our experiences and insights within the Dharma sharing.

Name: Sangha Essen
Description: Siehe Webseite

Name: Sangha im Nordend
Description: Sitting twice (25 minutes) with walking meditation in between. Sharing.

Name: Sangha Kahl
Description: Wir sind eine Gruppe von Frauen, die gemeinsam Achtsamkeit praktiziert und sich austauscht. Dabei sind wir zum Einen von der Plum Village-Tradition des buddhistischen Lehrers Thich Nhat Hanh inspiriert. Hier legen wir großen Wert auf Geh-Meditation. Zum Anderen praktizieren wir auch Wege von naturverbundener weiblicher Spiritualität, zum Beispiel inspiriert von Chameli Gad Ardagh (“Awakening Women”). Die Praxis wechselt sich ab:2 x Monat: Praxis nach Thich Nhat Hanh2 x Monat: Praxis in weiblicher Spiritualität oder lange Gehmeditation draußenOrganisatorisches: WANN | Wir treffen uns immer mittwochs ab ca. 19:00/19:30 und praktizieren ca. bis 21:00/21:30 Uhr gemeinsam.WO | Wir treffen uns in Privatwohnungen in Kahl. Bei schönem Wetter möchten wir in Zukunft auch den kompletten Abend draußen praktizieren. Die Gehmeditation führer wir immer draußen durch: geeignete Kleidung und Schuhe helfen daher.Praxismethoden: In der Plum Village-Tradition: Zu unseren Praxismethoden gehören Sitzmeditation (geleitet bzw. still), Gehmeditation; ergänzend ist z. B. Essmeditation möglichWeibliche Spiritualität: z. B. Yoga-Übungen; z. B. visuelle Reisen; z. B. Trommeln, singen oder tönen; z. B. Naturerlebnisse im Wald etc. Nicht bei jeden unserer Sangha-Abende muss es also eine “klassische” Meditation geben. Es gibt aber bei jedem Treffen eine spirituelle Praxis sowie einen Austausch (Dharma Sharing).Lehrer*innen / Inspirationen: Wir orientieren uns zum Einen an der Achtsamkeitspraxis und dem “Engagierten Buddhismus”, den Thich Nhat Hanh geprägt hat; zum Anderen an Chameli Gad Ardagh (“Awakening Women”)Wir freuen uns über weitere weibliche Mitglieder, die gemeinsam mit uns Achtsamkeit praktizieren und für die spirituellen Richtungen, die wir einschlagen, offen sind.Kontakt: Interessentinnen melden sich bitte am besten per E-Mail an MelaniePrengel@posteo.debeispielhafter Ablauf der Abende in der Plum Village Tradition:- 19:00 Uhr * Ankommen und “Check-in” (innerer Wetterbericht)- 19:10 Uhr * Gehmeditation draußen (z. B. in den Mainauen)- 20:00 Uhr * Heimkommen, Tee- und biologische Pause- 20:15 Uhr * Geleitete Meditation- 20:40 Uhr * Dharma-Text lesen- 21:00 Uhr * Dharma-Sharing- 21:30 Uhr * Ende

Name: Sangha Köln-Holweide
Description: 30min Sitzen, 15min Gehen, Achtsames Lesen, Pause im Schweigen, Achtsames Sharingmanchmal freudvolles Singen zum Abschluss

Name: Sangha Kreis Plön und Ostholstein
Description: We do sitting and walking meditation, read texts together and practice mindful sharing.

Name: Sangha Mudita
Description: We offer a day of minfulness every month on sunday (10-17h) and a meditiongroup once a week usually every week on Friday (19-21h). Advance registration is desirable.Wir bieten jedes Monat einen Tag der Achtsamkeit sonntags (10-17 Uhr)und eine wöchentliche Meditationsgruppe üblicherweise am Freitag (19-21 Uhr). Voranmeldung erwünscht.

Name: Sangha Nürnberg/Fürth
Description: Wir treffen uns regelmäßig donnerstags in Nürnberg und in Fürth und praktizieren Sitz- und Gehmeditation sowie achtsames Teilen. Wir lesen das Dharma aus Thays Büchern. Einmal im Monat rezitieren wir die fünf Achtsamkeitsregeln.Zudem treffen wir uns 1 Mal / Monat zu einem „Achtsamkeitssonntag“, um intensiv die Praxis der Achtsamkeit in unser tägliches Leben zu integrieren. Wir freuen uns auf Dich.

Name: Sangha Potsdam
Description: Seit dem 01.11.2022 praktizieren wir regelmässig Achtsamkeit in einer Gemeinschaft in Potsdam. Wir praktizieren, um das Glück zu nähren und das Leiden zu lindern. In uns selbst und in der Welt.SANGHA ABENDEDie Sanghaabende finden Montags von 19.00 bis ca. 21.15 Uhr statt. Geleitete Meditation, Sitzen in Stille, achtsames Gehen, Vortrag, achtsamer Austausch, gemeinsames Singen. Grundsätzlich sind volljährige Menschen zur Sangha eingeladen, die an einer langfristigen und regelmässigen Praxis in der Tradition des Plum Village / Thich Nhat Hanh interessiert sind. Alle Aktivitäten, die aus der Sangha organisiert werden, finden auf Spendenbasis statt.EINFÜHRUNGABENDVor dem ersten Besuch ist die Teilnahme an einem Einführungsabend in der Sangha Potsdam Bedingung. Am Am 13.05.2024 findet der kommende Einführungsabend statt. Für eine Anmeldung könnt ihr Benjamin eine Email schreiben.Besucher, die bereits Erfahrung mit der Praxis in der Tradition von Thich Nhat Hanh als Sanghamitglied oder Besucher eines Retreats im Plum Village haben, können die Praxisabende auch ohne Einführung nach einer Anmeldung per Email besuchen.ABLAUF DES EINFÜHRUNGSABENDS18.00 bis 18.15 Uhr Einlass, bitte Schuhe im Flur ausziehen und leise sprechen.18.15 bis 19.05 Uhr Einführung mit allgemeinen Informationen zur Sangha und zur Praxis.19.15 bis ca. 21.15 Uhr Praxis

Name: Sangha Wiesbaden/Mainz
Description: Our group is small but has been in existence about twenty years. We have weekly Meditation. We welcome new people.

Name: Smiling Stars Sangha
Description: We will practice together once a week, about 2 hours. We will do weather check-in, reading texts, walking meditation, dharma sharings, and from time to time we will do touching the earth and recite the 5 mindfulness trainings.

Name: Thich Nhât Hanh Lotus Sangha

Name: True Home Sangha
Description: Starting in 2024, we practice coming home together by sitting, walking, relaxation and sharing.

Name: Waldburg bei Ravensburg
Description: We practice guided metitation/walking meditation/silent meditation/mindful exchange on each meeting

Name: Wendland Sangha
Description: Unser Sangha abend beginnt mit einem lockeren Ankommen und Teetrinken, dann gehen wir in den Sangharaum und begeben uns in eine stille Meditation, dann folgt eine langsame gehmeditation, eine kleine Pause und dann eine geführte Meditation. Körperübungen schließen sich an und dann folgt das Dharma sharing. Am Ende singen wir ein Lied aus der Pliumvillage Tradition

Name: Zentrum für Yoga und Buddhismus
Description: In unserer Gruppe treffen sich Menschen aller Religionen und Nicht-Religionen. Angeleitet durch die Lehren des vietnamesischen Zen-Meisters Thich Nhat Hanh üben wir, ganz im gegenwärtigen Moment zu leben. Die Achtsamkeit auf den Atem, sowohl in der Sitz- als auch in der Gehmeditation, ist uns dabei ein zentrales Werkzeug. Im liebevollen Sprechen und achtsamen Zuhören üben wir uns darin, uns mit ganzem Herzen unseren Freundinnen und Freunden in der Sangha zuzuwenden.

Name: Buddhistische Meditationsgruppe in Karlsruhe in der Plum Village Tradition von Thich Nhat Hanh
Quelle des Mitgefühls
Description: The evenings consists of a guided mediation, walking meditation, mindful exercises, still sitting meditation, text-reading from Thay, and Dharma-sharing. Mindfulness Days are hosted 4 times a year, walking meditation every month in silence, different retreats, please check out the website for more information.

Name: Aare Sangha - Flowing like  a River
Description: Since 2022, we aspire to flow like the river Aare that runs through our city and canton. We don’t have a designated leader but are instead holding the space together. We meet weekly, and approximately every other month for a mindfulness day. Everyone is welcome.

Name: Achtsam und präsent im Alltag
Description: Entdecke die Kraft der Achtsamkeit in einer unterstützenden Gemeinschaft. Unsere Achtsamkeitsgruppe, inspiriert von der Tradition des buddhistischen Lehrers Thich Nhat Hanh (https://plumvillage.org/ oder https://www.eiab.eu/), lädt dich ein, einmal im Monat in Zürich innezuhalten, zu meditieren und die Kunst des achtsamen Lebens zu praktizieren.

She has visited Plum Village in 2006 and attended many retreats by Thay like the one in Castelfusano, Rome in 2008 among others. She received the Five Mindfulness Trainings by Thay in 2006.

Sangha en línea latinoamericana en español, y presencial en parques o plazas públicas

We have sitting meditation practices, walking meditation, study and reading of the Dharma and Thay texts, and sharing according to the structure of the Plum Village sanghas. Every month we also recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings together. All beliefs, religions and ages are welcome.

Name: Sangha de los Errantes
Description: Practicamos semanalmente una sesión de una hora y media de meditación sentada/caminando, cantos, lecturas de Dharma (textos de Thich Nhat Hanh), compartir el Dharma y observación de los 5 entrenamientos de la plena conciencia. La cita es en los departamentos de la Sangha (comunidad) que van rotando y, por ende, es de acceso libre. No se requiere experiencia previa.

Name: Sangha Bogotá
Description: We are the Bogota Sangha consisting of groups of practice that meet weekly presencially and virtually. In person meetings are every week on Monday (Sangha Puerta Abierta) and Saturday (Sangha Nuevos Lotos). We practice in Plum Village Tradition every meeting: chanting, reading Thay's books, meditation and Dharma sharing. From Tuesday to Saturday we also offer virtual meetings and practice.

Name: Grupo de Meditación Los Yoses
Description: reuniones en español

Name: Vivir Despiertos Ecuador
Description: Nuestras actividades están abiertas a todas las edades y son gratuitas. Organizamos cada año un retiro con los monjes de Plum Village. Our activities are open to all ages and free of charge. We organize every year a retreat with the monastics from Plum Village.

Name: La Comunidad de Plena Conciencia
Description: Queridos amigos, somos la continuación de Peten Sangha, reuniéndonos semanalmente, organizando días de mindfulness y retiros en la tradición de Plum Village. Nuestra sangha tiene cuatro miembros de OI y da la bienvenida a todos los que quieran compartir la práctica. Damos la bienvenida a dana para ayudar a pagar el alquiler (voluntario). Dear friends, we are the continuation of the Peten Sangha, gathering weekly, organizing days of mindfulness and retreats in the tradition of Plum Village. Our sangha has four OI members, and welcomes all who want to share the practice. We welcome dana to help pay rent (voluntary).

Name: Sangha Thak Ñan Willkamayu

Nos reunimos semanalmente para practicar durante 90 a 120 minutos en la tradición de Plum Village, que incluye meditación guiada, meditación caminando, compartir del dharma y recitación de 5 y 14 entrenamientos de atención plena. Esperamos que te unas a nosotros. Nuestra Sangha practica principalmente en español. (We are a Sanghita Andina in the Sacred Valley of Cusco, Peru. We gather weekly for 90mins - 120 mins of Plum Village practice which includes guided meditation, walking meditation, dharma sharing, recitation of 5 and 14 Mindfulness Trainings. We hope you will join us. Our Sangha practices primarily in Spanish.)

Name: Sangha Flor de Amêndoeira (Almond Blossom Sangha)
Description: Atualmente somos um grupo muito pequeno, reunindo-se todo primeiro domingo do mês em nossas casas particulares. Seguimos uma estrutura regular de leitura dos cinco Treinamentos de Mindfulness, uma meditação sentada guiada, uma meditação sentada silenciosa, uma leitura de um dos livros de Thich Nhat Hanh, uma meditação andando, compartilhamento do Dharma. Tanto falantes de português quanto de inglês são bem-vindos. / We are currently a very small group, meeting every first Sunday of the month at our private homes. We follow a regular structure of reading the five Mindfulness Trainings, a guided sitting meditation, a silent sitting meditation, a reading from one of Thich Nhat Hanh's books, a walking meditation, Dharma sharing. /  Both Portuguese and English speakers are welcome.

Name: Sangha Rio de Compaixão (River of Compassion)

Name: Neurodivergent Sangha
Description: We want to provide spiritual support, offer a safe and reliable place for Neurodivergents, so they can express and find peace in their conditions or diagnosis, without fear of judgments or discrimination.We recognise, embrace and accept our differences with the practice of Plum Village. Mindfulness helps us to regulate our mental and emotional behaviour, helps to control the brain into calm, improve our mood and reduce the feeling of pain. The Neurodivergence is not a disorder, it's just to be a little different. We are beautiful and colourful. You don't have to pretend to be anything else. There is nothing wrong with you. We say: “I can be myself, I accept it, I am loved. I am enough. We are enough”.

Name: Sangha Orléans / Petits Pas
Description: We are a group meeting regularly in and around Orléans to practice mindfulness meditation in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. These meetings are a wonderful way to regenerate and cultivate peace and joy together. We practice sitting meditation, meditative walking, mindful eating, deep relaxation, sharing the heart. If you would like to join us, whether you are familiar with this practice or not, you are welcome!

Name: Firenze - Queer Sangha Firenze
Description: With the guidance of Br Bao Tang we founded a young sangha for practitioners of all ages who identify with the LGBTQIA+ community or their issues. At every session we practise sitting and walking meditation, we read out a fragment of Thay's books and we have a Dharma sharing about our being both queer and Dharma practicioners, cultivating deep listening and loving speech. We meet every 2nd and 4th Friday of the month. We regularly organise mindful days and special thematic meetings to deepen our practise. As we are the only sangha designed for LGBTQIA+ in Italy, we also offer our siblings from outside Florence to attend our sessions online.

Description: retreats for the Mugello area

Name: Sangha del Mare
Description: Pratichiamo la meditazione seduta e camminata, ascoltiamo discorsi di Dharma e canti di Plum Village, godiamo di un'alimentazione consapevole e riserviamo uno spazio per la condivisione. We practice sitting and walking meditation, listen to Dharma talks and Plum Village chants, enjoy mindful eating and reserve a space for sharing.

Name: Zen and the Art of Saving the Planet - Roma
Description: [inglese e italiano] Monthly mindful gatherings for changemakers in Rome, grounded in Thich Nhat Hanh's latest book Zen and the Art of Saving the Planet. We meet in an art studio and have readings / meditation / reflection. We meet to nurture insight, compassion, community, and mindful action in service of the Earth.

Name: Bamboo Sangha
Description: This is the oldest sangha in Japan.

Name: Biwako Sangha
Description: In December 2018, we started hosting a monthly meeting of mindfulness meditation at the Myohoji temple in Omihachiman.

Name: Fukuoka Sangha
Description: We started practicing in 2017. Everyone is welcome.

Name: Heart of Yokohama, Tokyo & Kamakura Sangha
Description: We are a community of friends practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village since 2013. We hold monthly in-person meetings in Yokohama in both Japanese and English and offer online gatherings, including a monthly recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. All are welcome!

Name: Kanagawa Isehara Sangha
Description: Started 7 yrs ago. Located in a beautiful village, surrounded by forest covered hills. One-hour train ride from Tokyo.

Name: Kumamoto Sangha
Description: Started in March 2018. Please come and relax in our sangha. It is hosted at a small log cabin situated in the rich nature of south Aso (Minami-Aso).

Name: Kyoto Mindfulness Practice Group
Description: We practice according to our own seasonal theme. Walking Meditation along the Kamogawa river is very plesant and enjoyable.

Name: Mori no Sangha
Description: Started in May 2017. Let's spend time with our sangha to slow down in the rich nature of the tree-clad city of Sendai.

Name: Mt. Fuji Sangha
Description: We are a small sangha, located at the foot of Mt. Fuji. The access is 7 min. taxi ride from the Fuji Yoshida train station. The walking meditation in the nearby forest is so calming for the body and mind.

Name: Nagoya Sangha
Description: We are closely-bonded, family-like sangha and would like to encourage more male friends to join us, as majority are female.

Name: Nikko Sangha
Description: Monthly Day of Mindfulness on 1st Sunday.

Name: Sakura Lotus Sangha
Description: Sakura Lotus Sangha was established in 2016 with the support of Lang Mai Monastic brothers and sisters as well as Tokyo Sangha. We organize a mindful practice day each month for Vietnamese who are living or studying in the Kanto area. Our mindful day activities include chanting, mindful singing, dharma talk, mindful lunch, total relaxation, sitting meditation, dharma sharing, and walking meditation. Our purpose is to create an environment for Vietnamese peaple who want to practice following the Lang Mai tradition.

Name: Shikoku Sangha
Description: We are a small sangha learning slowly and gently, little by little.

Name: Shizuoka Kannon Sangha
Description: Started in August 2019 by a family with an infant. Offering a monthly meditation meeting in a cozy and at-home atmosphere. Families are welcome!

Name: Tamagawa Samgha
Description: Started in January 2016. Embraced in the warmth of the sangha, all of us can come back to our true selves.

Name: Tokyo Sangha
Description: Sharing practices more focusing on our body, heart, and interconnectedness. We mostly want to practice in nature (or near nature) so it helps us enjoy who we really are as mother nature’s children.

Name: Wind of Smile Sangha
Description: Our sangha started when dharma teachers An-huong and Thu visited Japan for the first time in 2013. Our main locations are Chuo-ward and Setagaya-ward in Tokyo. You can come and relax in our sangha. There are many newcomers each time.

Name: Sangha De Witte Wolk en Sangha Verspronck
Sangha Den Haag // Middle Way Sangha
Leven in Aandacht Vlaanderen (previously Sangha Interzijn in Aandacht)
Tshedisa Sangha
Description: Meets at the Tshedisa institute

Name: Bulgarian Plum Village Sangha
Description: The Bulgarian Plum Village Sanga was established in 2021. We meet online and practice usually Guided Sitting Meditation (or Slow Walking, Deep Relaxation etc.), presentation of Plum Village Practice (text, Dharma talk or video) and Dharma Sharing. Sometimes we have online sessions with Plum Village monastics who offer us short Dharma Talks and/or Questions and Answers sessions.

Name: No-Mud-No-Lotus Sangha
Description: Sitting and walking meditation, 5MT recitation, chanting, dharma sharing, days of mindfulness, supporting ourselves as a community, enjoy being alive.

Name: Rain of Compassion Sangha  (繁體中文)
Description: Led by Plum Village monastic brothers and sisters.

Name: Interbeing Community of Mindful Living
Description: Interbeing is an Association founded by Lay practitioners who aspire to create opportunities for the Danish population to participate in activities in the Plum Village tradition. We facilitate Days of Mindfulness, online Study groups, online training in cooperation with Lay Dharma teachers from OI UK, yearly 5 MT ceremonies in cooperation with EIAB, online recitations of 5 MT, recitations of 5MT in the Temple with our local Dharma Teacher, library service for the community. We support Danish Sanghaes who ask for help with Facilitation training etc. We have been lucky to facilitate activities with both Monastics from Plum Village France and EIAB and plan to create more in the future. If you need a local Sangha or wish to create one, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.

Name: Thich Nhat Hanh Sangha - Copenhagen
Description: We welcome you to our sangha - we practice in English. We gather to practice together, watering seeds of mindfulness and happiness. Together we 1. meditate, 2. read a text by Thay, and 3. have dharma sharing.

Name: Valkoinen Lumme - Tampere White Waterlily Tampere
Valkoinen Lumme Helsinki - White Waterlily Helsinki
Description: We have some newcomers. Our basic group is very stable, so the practice is deeper. We are four people who take care of Sangha activities.

Name: Szelíd Mosoly Sangha (Gentle Smile Sangha)
Description: The Szelíd Mosoly (Gentle Smile) Sangha was founded by Jan Boswijk and Katalin Orosz in 2007. We organize two retreats a year, one in the Summer and one in the Spring, led by Jan Boswijk and Hilly Bol. We have in-person meetings for members every month, and an online meditation open to everyone every Wednesday.

Name: Cloud Sangha
Description: In members homes (pls call for details)

Name: Lotus Sangha
Description: We have a weekly meeting of between 1.5 - 2 hours in the Plum Village Tradition. We have guided meditation, sitting mediation, silent meditation, read a text (a book of Thay's or a sutra) and Dharma sharing. Once a month we read the Five Mindfulness Trainings.

Name: Mindfulness Sangha Jerusalem
Description: Please call or email before coming to the Sangha

Name: Morning Light
Description: Thich Nhat Hanh's tradition in English.

Name: Peaceful Path Sangha
Description: Welcome all practitioners to join our group. Together we follow the path and practice sitting, walking meditation, tea and sharing.We enjoy the presence of each other in midfulness, allowing us to return to our true home in silence.

Name: Pebbles Sangha
Description: We meet weekly to practice the art of mindful living in the plum village tradition, as taught by Zen master, Thich Nhat Hanh

Name: Being Zen
Description: Sitting, walking, mindful movements, Thay's book readings, dharma sharing, drinking tea...

Name: Mindfulness Practice Sangha of Korea (주의깊음수련상가)
Description: A Sangha in Korea that practices mindfulness and follows the Plum Village tradition since April 2019.

Name: Lotus in the Woods
Description: We are a small sangha and meet regularly in a house near the forest since 2018. We do meditations, we love discussions and tea. New people are very welcome!

Name: Drivende Skyers Sangha (Drifting Clouds Sangha)
Description: Deep relaxation, sitting and walking meditation, monthly talks about Thays teachings, observing the Five Mindfulness Trainings, Mindfulness Days with walking in nature. One to two yearly retreats.

Name: Fjell Sangha - Mountain Sangha
Description: Our regular practice follows the Vietnamese Lin Chi (jap. Rinzai) tradition as presented by Thich Nhat Hanh. This includes the methods of sitting and walking meditation, Mindfull Movements, Deep Relaxation, Guided Meditation, Gathas, Touching the Earth, Sharing, Tea ceremoni and more. We hosted retreats regularly.

Name: HavSangha - OceanSangha
Description: A young, new sangha in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh and Plum Village. In this outdoor Sangha we share our practice through meditation, dharma sharings and tea.

Name: Hvilende Mose Sangha (Resting Moss)
Description: We meet sundays every week for meditation, sharing and tea!

Name: Oasis of Peace Sangha
Description: Various meditation practices (sitting in nature outside or inside, walking in the forest near lakes and fjords, cooking together and sharing meal), watching dharma talks by Thich Nhat Hanh or Plum Village monastics, discussions on philosophical or psychological topics.

Name: Sangha Snow Crystal (Snøkrystallen Sangha)Sangha Chân Tâm (Vietnamese-speaking)
Sangha Bilong Groim Klia Save. (This means Sangha for developing wisdom and understanding)
Description: We meet at Kali Island, Lessau Village, Bipi Island, and Manus Province.Retreats are held near the three main villages and regular meetings amongst the Sangha members in each of the three villages.The main retreat house is opposite Kali Island on Manus Island at Eherman, looking over Kali Bay.Books have been published in Tok Pisin & English at the Buddhist Education Foundation in Taiwan for use by the Sangha

Name: Humanum-Values Based Mindfulness Practice
Description: We are a group of HUMANUM practitioners following the path of Thich Nhat Hanh tradition. We chose Thay's teachings as guidelines as we find them helpful to manage our daily lives easier and better. We call our practice Values Based Mindifuness because in our understanding mindfulness does not exist without compassion as the fundamental value. We follow the Five Mindfulness Trainings and read them regularly supporting it with recitation of other Thay writings. At the meetings we have 20 minutes of sitting meditation, 20 minutes of walking meditation and 20 minutes of lying meditation followed by Dharma sharing. We organize Humanum Mindfulness Days when we cook, eat,clean and watch Thay's lectures together and follow the 20-20-20 practice scheme twice a day. We are opened to everyone wishing to join us on the path of mindfulness practice.

Name: Sangha Uśmiech Buddy |Smile of the Buddha
Sangha Uśmiech Radośći | Smile of Joy
Description: We are a small, inclusive community where we do sitting and walking meditation, explore the Dharma and share about our mindful living. We recite the 5 mindfulness trainings monthly.

Name: Touching The Earth Sangha, Sangha Dotyk Ziemi
Sangha Romania
Description: The aim is to build a local community of mindfulness practitioners. Intended practice includes weekly walking or sitting meditation. Once per month, if participants agree, we can stream dharma talks or we can hold dharma sharing sessions. Once the community grows we can organize dedicated retreats.

Name: Sangha Slovenia
Description: Smo Sangha Slovenija, sveže ustanovljena za prakso v tradiciji Plum Village.  We are the Sangha Slovenia, freshly formed to practice in the Plum Village tradition.

Name: Rosensanghan
Description: Rosensanghan är en meditationsgrupp i Göteborg, som praktiserar i tradition efter den vietnamesiske Zenmästaren Thich Nhat Hanh. Vi tränar oss i medveten närvaro och djupt lyssnande, och stödjer varandra i strävan att fördjupa vår meditation och vår förmåga att leva väl, för oss själva och för andra.Rosensanghan har funnits sedan 2004. Några av oss har varit med länge och troget - andra kommer och går, utifrån behov och intresse. Bland oss finns både personer som har en stark personlig relation till just den här buddhistiska traditionen, och personer som har sina andliga rötter i andra sammanhang. Du måste inte vara eller bli buddhist för att praktisera med oss - det viktiga är att du har ett intresse av att ta del av traditionens meditationspraktik med ett öppet hjärta och sinne.

Name: Source of Joy/Glädjens Källa
Description: We meet every second week live and every second week on-line for sitting, walking and dharma sharing.Monthly recitation of the 5 MT and 14 MT.

Name: Sunflower Sangha
Description: We ask new friends to please email us in advance, since we need to explain the address and give them a passcode for the door.

Name: Morning Light Sangha
Description: Morning Light sangha was established in Taipei in 2011, to introduce PV practices to local practitioners to prepare and promote Thay’s teaching tour that year. It is the first lay PV sangha in Taiwan and has continued except for a brief hiatus from time to time.We meet twice a month, conducted one week in English and the other in Taiwanese mandarin. We practice all Plum Village practices such as walking, sitting, touching the earth, total relaxation, beginning anew, singing PV songs and read an excerpt from Thay’s books before dharma sharing and end with a metta meditation. We recite the 5 Mindfulness trainings every other month.

Name: Sangha Som Pou
Description: Bien que situés au Nord de la Thaïlande, on est bien francophone et la plus grande partie des pratiquants qui participent dans nos retraites sont francophones....

Name: Istanbul Lotus River Sangha
Description: We practice guided seated mindfulness meditation, walking meditation, readings from Thay, and Dharma sharing. Anyone is welcome regardless of race, religion, gender, or sexual orientation.

Name: Leaf of Gratitude Sangha
Description: We do sitting and walking meditation, singing songs and chants, dharma sharing, sutra and Five Mindfulness Trainings reading, hugging, mindful movements

Name: Inner Peace Meditation Center
Description: Friendly community of practitioners. Chanting is in Vietnamese, but all are welcome to meditate while others are chanting. There are a few monastics who lead services.

Name: Vietnamese: Tình Huynh ĐệEnglish: Brotherhood and Sisterhood Sangha
Description: English: A garden of compassion that started blooming in late 2015. We always keeps our door open to welcome dear friends to build a small garden of harmony where we support and nourish one another on the path of practicing Understanding and Compassion.Vietnamese: Một khu vườn thương hé nở từ cuối năm 2015 với số lượng thanh viên trong ban chăm sóc khiêm tốn ~ chỉ khoảng 5 người. Khu vườn thương luôn mở rộng cánh cổng đề chào đón tất cả các bạn ghé chơi cũng như tất cả các bạn thương mến ở lại, cùng chung tay góp sức xây dựng một khu vườn nhỏ hòa hợp, nâng đỡ và nuôi dưỡng nhau trên con đường thực tập Hiểu và Thương.
